https://nl.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=d45446fbb0b1b88d,indeed,Quantitative Market Researcher,Conjointly,https://nl.indeed.com/cmp/Conjointly,"Amsterdam, NH, NL",fulltime,2024-07-04,,,,,True,,,,"**Conjointly offers a powerful and intuitive platform and expert support for insights about markets, customers, product, and pricing questions.** We are an Australian-headquartered provider of quantitative research services to big and small companies (mostly in USA and Europe). Through automation, we increase efficiency for our clients, but maintain a human connection and high research quality. As we grow (in number of products that we offer and in clients’ awareness of us), we need passionate researchers, software developers, and other team members to join us for remote roles.
**Responsibilities**
You will support them from proposal to delivery of results on some of the most complex and interesting custom projects. This will include but not limited to:
* Research on projects commissioned by clients
* Craft suitable/ relevant survey questions based on the topic of research to best achieve the desired results
* Data analysis and report writing
* Building client-friendly customised Excel models
* Preparation of meeting-ready presentation slides (i.e. PowerPoint report) by transforming survey responses into actionable data-driven consumer stories/ insights
* The administrative function includes but not limited to image standardisation, open-end coding, exporting and importing data files and organise, collate and clean data files
* Survey testing: offer great experience to respondents by ensuring the links and logics are working well and redirected accordingly
* Prepare documentation, algorithms, and other materials
* Occasionally, you will be supporting and advising our users in the creation of their own market research using our platform, including consulting them via email and over the phone
* Work closely with different stakeholders within the organisation for internal and external projects
**Requirements**
* Excellent proficiency in English language, both spoken and written
* Keen interest in quantitative market research
* This role requires the applicant to have critical and logical thinking, good numerical and analytical skills
* Excellent skills in Excel (pivot table, formulas) - experience in working with large datasets
* Excellent skills in Statistics and familiarity with R (preferred), Python, or SPSS
* Applicant has to have at least **2 years of working experience** in consumer insights or market research, statistical modelling and analysis
* Experience and knowledge of conjoint and MaxDiff analysis will be an added advantage
* Bachelor’s Degree, with preference for Statistics, Marketing, Mathematics, Sociology, or related
**Benefits**
**This job wins over working for a normal market research firm for the following reasons:**
* We aim not to do the same thing twice. If it needs to be repeated, we must automate it.
* We are recognised as experts in our research methods, which means we are engaged for some of the most exciting types of quantitative analyses.
* You will have opportunities for professional growth as fast as our operations grow.",r,https://apply.workable.com/j/095F02D23A,,,,,,,,,,,d45446fbb0b1b88d,,en,,,

https://nl.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=b6e32f35e666aa0b,indeed,Generative AI internship,Cognizant Technology Solutions,https://nl.indeed.com/cmp/Cognizant-Technology-Solutions,"Amsterdam, NH, NL",fulltime,2024-07-03,,,,,False,,,Mukta.wajpe@cognizant.com,"**Cognizant Digital Studio: Generative AI internships**
Location: Amsterdam
**About the role**

Are you looking for an appealing internship where you can take your own skills to the next level? Then you should consider this internship at Cognizant! In close collaboration with the AI & Analytics practice, we offer a very appealing internship to create Generative AI solutions and prototypes that support the overall studio experience. In our Digital Studio, we use Generative AI, Robotics, IoT, VR, and immersive experiences to show our capabilities to visitors. This internship is designed to offer an hands-on experience in the fast-evolving field of artificial intelligence: the opportunity to work on a specific – and visible - Generative AI-related project.
Curious how the Digital Studio currently looks like? Watch our tour on YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cmJUdSog-jo
Want to know more about our Data and AI offering?
https://www.cognizant.com/us/en/services/ai#spy-offerings-item-646ae4b1ff
**About Cognizant**

Cognizant (Nasdaq-100: CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant is ranked 194 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com. Next to internship positions in our Digital Studio / Benelux HQ in Amsterdam, we have an extensive graduate development plan to guide our graduates in the first steps in their careers. This internship could be a steppingstone to your first job.
**Key responsibilities**
* Assist in developing and optimizing Generative AI models and demos
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate AI solutions into business processes
* Conduct research on emerging AI trends and technologies
* Participate in AI project planning and implementation
**Learning opportunities**
* Work with your peers under the guidance of industry experts in AI and machine learning
* Gain practical experience with advanced AI tools and platforms
* Develop skills in problem solving, teamwork and project management
* Opportunity to contribute to impactful AI projects
* Access to the Cognizant GenAI learning program, including learning paths from partners like Google, Microsoft and AWS.
**This is what you bring**

We are looking for eager and motivated students who are not afraid to learn. You know how to organize your work and make the connections needed to progress. You are interested in emerging AI technology and the possibilities it brings. You have a practical mindset, combined with plenty of creativity and initiative. Innovation is your passion. You are proactive in communicating and cooperating within a team, and you know what is needed to complete the project. In addition to this, you are:
* Preferably looking for an internship/project of around 20 weeks
* Preferably available to start on the 1st of September 2024 or earlier
* You are following a technical study at university level or you are a fourth year vocational (HBO+) student in a subject like Computer Science, AI or Data Science
* You follow trends and developments in digital, you are interested in emerging technologies like AI, LLMs, GANs, etc.
* You have already some experiences with AI concepts, software development and programming languages (Python or R)
* You have some fundamental knowledge of AI principles, neural networks, machine learning models and deep learning
* You are aware of the ethical considerations in AI, like bias, fairness and privacy
* You are an effective communicator in both Dutch and English
We provide freedom and space to contribute your point of view. Part of the internship is a monthly allowance.
Interested or keen to learn more? Contact us directly!
**Diversity and Inclusion at Cognizant:**

At *Cognizant, we believe diversity and inclusion are at the heart of our ability to execute successfully and consistently over the long term. We recognize that our people are our most important asset. We strive to create an environment where all associates feel comfortable to be themselves, feel accepted and can therefore thrive both personally and professionally. We continue to drive D&I throughout our organization to unlock the insights, imagination and innovation of our associates, as well as reflect the diversity of our clients and communities. We are a Dutch and European Top Employer and continually drive employment recognition and engagement through employee friendly policies and affinity groups such as “Women Empowered”, “Embrace LGBTQ+” and “Race Equality Network”. For more information, see* *https://careers.cognizant.com/global/en/diversity-and-inclusion*
**Recruiters contact details:**
* Name: Mukta Wajpe

* Email address: Mukta.wajpe@cognizant.com",r,https://click.appcast.io/track/jzrdctw-org?cs=hqw,https://www.cognizant.com/,"500 Frank W. https://nl.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=55439686c8d7760d,indeed,Pricing & Analytics Specialist,ASSA ABLOY Group,https://nl.indeed.com/cmp/Assa-Abloy-Group,"Heerhugowaard, NH, NL",,2024-07-03,,,,,False,,,elzbieta.latka-likh@assaabloy.com,"**Advanced Pricing & Analytics Specialist –** **Heerhugowaard/ Landskrona/ Malmö**
Can you bring your analytical skills to our Pricing team? If so join our team and enjoy a culture that empowers you to build a career you can be proud of.

**What you would do as one of our** **Advanced Pricing & Analytics Specialist**As our Advanced Pricing & Analytics Specialist you will drive price realization through engagement with the local Service managers, you will also gather data via internal and external surveys as well as through the daily monitoring of other pricing and profitability activities. This exciting opportunity will allow you to collaborate with a variety of stakeholders to help understand their pricing, analytical and reporting needs to help deliver the best service. In this role you will also be able to showcase your creativity by producing visually appealing dashboards and reports to communicate data and insights
You would also:
* Provide training and support to the (pricing) community on the use of reporting tools and systems and assists in troubleshooting and problem-solving
* Be responsible for automating the report generation processes, streamlining data collection and analysis, and improving report accuracy and consistency
* Identify opportunities for improving report quality, accuracy, and efficiency and recommend changes to processes and systems
* Ensure that all data and information used in reports are confidential, secure, and in compliance with data protection regulations
* Ensure that pricing and SKU data is correct, archived and available at all times to the community.
**The skills and experience you need**
We are looking for someone who:
* Is fluent in spoken and written English, any proficiency with a Bachelor’s degree in Business, Data Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or related field
* Has experience in pricing and data analytics with strong attention to detail and accuracy
* Is an advanced user of Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint and Outlook) with emphasis on Excel VBA
* Has experience with business intelligence tools such as Business Objects, PowerBI, QlikView, or Tableau
* Experience with data science tools such as Python, R, or similar to extract, clean and prepare large data would be advantageous
**What we offer**
We’re passionate about providing amazing opportunities and benefits, so you can continue and progress a lifelong career with us – here’s what we have to offer:
* Learning and career development opportunities, whether it’s online learning, management training or enhancing your skills.
* A competitive salary and incentive schemes.
* Variety of benefits including a attractive company pension, discount portal, recognition scheme and wellbeing program… to name just a few!
**We review applications regularly, so don’t wait**
We are building diverse, inclusive teams, and encourage applications from everyone who can see themselves working with us.
To make sure your personal data is safe, we don’t look at any applications sent by email or post.
If you have any questions about the role or the process, email Elzbieta Latka-likh, Sourcer at elzbieta.latka-likh@assaabloy.com

https://nl.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=421fea22e2df030f,indeed,Business Processes Consultant,SAP,https://nl.indeed.com/cmp/SAP,"Den Bosch, NB, NL",fulltime,2024-07-03,,,,,True,,,Careers@sap.com,"**We help the world run better**

Our company culture is focused on helping our employees enable innovation by building breakthroughs together. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from. Apply now!
**ROLE DESCRIPTION**:

The consultant role is a strategic role for SAP Adoption Services Centre, acting as an experienced trusted advisor with our most valued customers. In this role, you will be expected to be involved and lead functional and business discussions to support in the delivery of consulting services to best address our customer's needs. The candidate will be expected to be at the forefront of innovation topics with our customers with hands on delivery expertise essential to meet the high personal and team delivery targets globally.
The successful candidate will have detailed hands-on delivery experience in **at least 2** of the following solutions:
* SAP Analytics Cloud (including planning)
* SAP HANA Cloud
* SAP Datasphere
* Data Science Languages (Python, R, etc.)
* S/4 HANA (including Embedded Analytics)
In summary:

* Delivery consulting (creation of business blueprints, architecture, implementation based on a blueprint, creation of test cases, test scheduling and execution, key user training, go live support, and post go live support)
* Support in escalated projects
* Performance of feasibility studies / solution reviews
* Support of pre-sales activities
* Regular responsibility as a sub project team leader internally and externally
* Subject matter expert and internal team lead to enable others
**EDUCATION AND QUALIFICATIONS / SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES:**

In addition to a strong business and analytics background, the position requires strong problem-solving and consulting capabilities with the ability to communicate effectively in an international team environment.
The ideal candidate will need to be immediately billable to customers and covers a major part of the following expertise areas:
**Background:**
* University / Master's degree in computer science, mathematics, physics, engineering or equivalent
* Strong analytics industry know how
* Fluent in English
**Personal skills:**
* Experience of working in a virtual team is highly desirable – this role will require a lot of remote working on client sites as a single point of contact for SAP
* Ability to travel up to 100% and at immediate notice **throughout Europe** and possibly globally
* Strong work ethic, dependable, and responsible
* Easily able to stay on top of technology innovations and eager to continuously develop yourself in new topics
* Must be a flexible self-starter who can ramp up with new technologies quickly and can adapt to a growing and rapidly evolving team
* Willingness to participate in the sales process as a subject matter expert
* Ability to inspire confidence and work with all levels of client and internal staff
* Ability to deliver clear, concise presentations to non-scientific audiences
* High energy, clear goal orientation and strong work ethic
column2: “can do” attitude

column1: * Excellent verbal and written communication skills
column2: English at fluent level is a must

column1: * Motivated, and able to work effectively under pressure
**Customer facing skills:**
* Ability to capture customer requirements and translate them into software specifications
* Ability to present complex information in a clear and precise manner
column2: with non-technical audience

column1: * Professional appearance and demeanour

* Presentation skills – ability to create professional presentations, handle proper setup of location, use technical/visual aid, have adequate body language and vocabulary, proactively engage with customer and handle questions
**Work experience:**
* 5+ years overall experience in business and technical roles
* A **minimum of 2 full cycle implementations**
* Very strong know how in **at least 2** of the solutions listed is essential
* Track record of successfully implementing production of analytics projects in challenging environments
**Location** - This position can based in the Netherlands or the UK and we are not able to consider candidates who require a relocation.
**We build breakthroughs together**

SAP innovations help more than 400,000 customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with 200 million users and more than 100,000 employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, we build breakthroughs, together.
**We win with inclusion**

SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.

SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com

For SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral Policy. Specific conditions may apply for roles in Vocational Training.
**EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability:**

Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability.
Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

https://nl.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=509d2665d9d96c91,indeed,Senior Data Scientist - Data & AI,FalconSmartIT,https://nl.indeed.com/cmp/Falconsmartit,"Den Haag, ZH, NL",,2024-07-02,,,,,False,,,rachana@falconsmartit.com,"Job Title: **Senior Data Scientist - Data & AI**
Job Location: **The Hague, Netherlands**
Job Type: **Permanent/ Onsite**
**JD: Roles & responsibilities**
**You must possess.**
* Possess 13–17 years of hands-on work experience as a Data Scientist.
* Outstanding written and verbal communication skills, with a flair for compelling storytelling.
* Strong communication and presentation skills to convey complex findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, and SQL.
* Expertise in various machine learning algorithms, techniques, including deep learning and LLMs.
* Knowledge of big data technologies and experience on cloud platforms like AWS or Azure as well as managing large datasets.
* Experience in MLOps practices and deploying machine learning models into production environments.
* Project management abilities to lead data science initiatives from conception to completion.
* Critical thinking and problem-solving capabilities to address unforeseen challenges in data science projects.
* Mentoring and leadership skills to guide junior team members and foster a data-driven culture.
* Ability to contribute to business strategy by aligning data science initiatives with organisational goals.
* Ability to work with real-time data and implement real-time analytics.
* Experience applying various machine learning techniques to telecom-specific use cases.
* Engage with business and technology stakeholders, collect necessary information, comprehend client expectations, clarify details through workshops, and propose and discuss optimal solutions.
* Work closely with the pre-sales, account, and sales teams, providing support throughout all phases of Data & AI deal pursuits and expand existing projects.
**Good to have.**
* Possess a Bachelor or Masters degree data science, statistics, computer science, or a related quantitative field.
* Engage with clients effectively and play a key role in achieving successful outcomes for clients.
* Strong understanding of telecom industry domain knowledge, including communication networks, user behaviour analysis, and network optimisation.
* Leadership abilities, strategic thinking, and experience managing data science teams and projects are crucial.
* Demonstrate continuous learning to stay updated with the latest advancements in Data & AI.
* Demonstrated expertise in designing, developing, and implementing state-of-the-art GenAI applications.
* A good understanding of Ethical AI and AI Governance.
* Contribute to the development of solutions and automation accelerators, and mentor emerging Data & AI talent.
* Familiarity with the business landscape throughout Europe.
* Willing to travel up to 10 to 20% of the time, primarily within the NL and sometimes within Europe.
**What We Offer.**
* An entrepreneurial environment, fostering a highly team-oriented culture, with the opportunity to shape the future of Hexaware's Data & AI practice.
* Competitive compensation, which includes a base salary and variable pay that is dependent on both individual and company performance.
* You will work with the best minds on cutting-edge data, analytics, and AI themes (e.g., Generative AI) that have a real impact across industries.
* We foster a performance-driven culture that simultaneously prioritises teamwork and collaboration, including regular company-wide events.
* Flexible working arrangements, provided that all commitments to both clients and the company are fulfilled.
* High emphasis on learning and personal development, with generous support from Hexaware in terms of time and budget allocation.
* We foster a diverse and inclusive culture where you're valued for your individuality and encouraged to express your unique perspectives.
**Regards,**
Rachana

https://nl.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=a0aa773cefdb9f9d,indeed,Senior BI Specialist,Exact,https://nl.indeed.com/cmp/Exact-9,"Delft, ZH, NL",,2024-07-02,,,,,True,,,,"(Sr.) Professional Job Netherlands, Delft Corporate Functions Netherlands

As a Senior BI Specialist, you participate and provide input for data integration, transformation of multiple data source systems, develop data warehouses with a combination of business intelligence, data visualization and reporting tools. Next to this, you advocate self-service analytics and will give training sessions to empower the business to build their own reports, dash boards and power BI models. At Exact, your technical skills and “dare to” mentality, can lead to the best innovations. And where is your career heading? That’s up to you. The career opportunities are unprecedented. 2000 enterprising colleagues have already paved the way. Are you on board?
**This = the job you are looking for:**
* Provide expert guidance on Business Intelligence (BI) skills and technologies.
* Develop scalable and maintainable BI applications to meet business objectives.
* Develop security and authentication standards for the department.
* Maintain accurate and complete technical architectural documents.
* Define BI standards, guidelines and best practices for business groups and technical teams.
* Support BI tools upgrades in development, testing and documentation.
* Perform maintenance and troubleshooting activities for BI tools.
* Diagnose and resolve BI tool capacity issues.
* Recommend strategies to improve performance and capacity of BI tools.
* Address customer queries and issues in a timely manner.
* Provide technical training on BI tools to team members.
* Collaborate with BI Administrators, Developers and Analysts for successful development of BI reporting and analysis solutions.
* Work with business groups and technical teams to develop and maintain data warehouse platform for BI reporting.
* Design and build tabular models writing complex DAX formulae.
* Build scalable data warehouse solutions using PaaS and SaaS services in Microsoft cloud.
* Address master data issues and provide data solutions to manage them.

You will join the 6 colleagues in the Corporate BI department. They are known for their great technical knowledge and smooth cooperation. Asking for help if necessary and offering help if possible is part of their DNA. We have few predefined paths, which gives you plenty of room to choose your own.
**The main responsibilities of the department are:**

* Key operations of the business intelligence team begin with the design and deployment of the BI architecture, which includes source systems, data warehouses, and a combination of business intelligence, data visualization, and reporting tools.
* Advocate self-service analytics and train to empower Business to build their own reports, dash boards and power BI models.
* Agree to SLA’s for providing front line support to the business users on the BI cubes and deliver big fixes and enhancements on a timely basis.
**This = what you bring**

With us, you can be yourself, and we would love to discover what sets you apart. For the position of Senior BI Specialist, it’s helpful if you have analytical skills and that you have good communications skills. What’s more, you bring:
* Microsoft suite of BI tools (Both On-premises and Cloud)
* Relevant experience in building data warehouse solutions in cloud using PaaS and SaaS services.
* Around 10 or more years of experience
* Reporting tools, mainly Power BI
* Data modeling, data warehousing, data visualization & analytics
* Programming languages like Python, .net, R would be added value.
**This = what you get**

At Exact we value the balance between work and relaxation. You can work up a sweat in our own gym or take a break at the coffee bar. Empty your head and then tackle your daily tasks with renewed energy. And, of course, that's not all. As a Senior BI Specialist, based on 40 hours per week, you can also count on:
* A competitive salary package incl. a 13th month and of course 8% holiday allowance
* An international, innovative and hybrid working environment, with the flexibility to work from home or any of our offices
* Over 2000 colleagues worldwide of which more than 500 in technology.
* 27 vacation days and in addition, loyalty days
column2: one for each year in service with a max of 5

**About Exact**

Exact develops cloud software for small and medium-sized companies and their accountants. The products automate business processes in areas such as Finance and HR and provide specific ERP solutions for wholesale distribution, manufacturing, projects and construction. This saves time and provides insight. It enables customers to work efficiently, make informed decisions and continue growing. More than 675,000 companies primarily in the Netherlands, Belgium and Germany already rely on Exact's software.

Exact was founded in 1984 in Delft, the Netherlands, which is still the location of our head office. Every day, more than 2,000 ambitious professionals work on innovation. Driving responsible business, with respect for each other, the environment and society is central to this. For more information, visit www.exact.com.
Contact Arthur Fransen

https://nl.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=204a87d7f55976ae,indeed,Digital phenotyping data analyst,Solynta,https://nl.indeed.com/cmp/Solynta,"Wageningen, GE, NL",,2024-07-02,,,,,True,,,recruitment@solynta.com,"Solynta is a young seed company that develops and implements hybrid breeding technology in diploid potato. This technology will accelerate the development of innovative potato varieties, with true seed as starting material. We have a position open for a:
Digital phenotyping data analyst (MSc/PhD)

For our selections on plants and on tubers we are looking for possibilities to use digital phenotyping methods for improving the data collection. You are a person that determines the best way to phenotype different traits, and that calibrates digital phenotyping data with actual plant measurements. You have experience in image analysis, machine learning and crop modelling. The goal of this position is to develop methods of digital phenotyping to a tool that breeders can use to make selections.
Key activities / responsibilities
Image analysis of plants and plant material
Processing of raw data into interpretable information
Correlation of digital phenotyping data to plant traits
Develop new digital phenotyping methods
Close collaboration with breeders, agronomists, scientific software engineers and data engineers
Requirements
An MSc in biosystems engineering or similar with an applied remote sensing component
Proficiency in traditional and deep-learning-based computer vision and image analysis for plant growth measurement
Working knowledge of contemporary statistical learning methods and tools
Programming skills with expertise in R, Python or other statistical software
including traditional statistical analysis and machine learning
A good command of geospatial data analysis and visualization methods
Experience with digital phenotyping techniques
Knowledge of the spectral properties of plants and their relations to plant growth processes
Interest to translate science into a usable product
Ability to work closely together with diverse people
**What We Offer:**
An enthusiastic and growing team with ambition and passion to drive real change
The opportunity to join a dedicated team working on ground-breaking innovations for improving the global food supply
Home office is situated in Wageningen
Opportunities for growth and development within a dynamic organization
**Application:**
To join our team as a Digital phenotyping data analyst please submit the form below including:
A short motivation why this position and working at Solynta both align with your personal goals and ambitions.
Your CV
For inquiries about the application process and the vacancy, please email recruitment@solynta.com.
If you have any questions about the vacancy, please contact Julia Stockem, tel. 06 51894987. The application deadline is July 31, 2024.

https://nl.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=ac123e05df9aa2fa,indeed,Senior UX Researcher,Mews,https://nl.indeed.com/cmp/Mews-6,"Amsterdam, NH, NL",internship,2024-07-02,,,,,True,,,,"#### **Can you help us change the world?**

It's true. At Mews, we dream big. As a Hotel Tech unicorn valued at $1.2b, we're propelling new-generation cloud technology within global hospitality. With our industry-leading property management solution**,** we're enabling the world's most revolutionary hospitality brands to accelerate their digital transformation.

We're on the lookout for ambitious, tenacious and passionate people who want to join the next generation of innovators and disrupt the hospitality industry with us. Sound good so far? Keep reading and tumble down the Mews rabbit hole...
‍ #### **About the role**

First things first: you want to know what you're actually applying for. It's impossible to capture every nuance of a role – especially at a rapidly growing company like Mews – but if we had to distil it down to a job description (which we do because this is a job description), it would be this:

We are looking for an experienced Mixed Method Sr. UX Researcher with undeniable passion to drive innovation in the Guest Experience field and can inspire design decisions to take Hospitality solutions to the next level.
**We are looking for:**
**Specialist in Customer Experience research**

* With strong expertise in mixed-method research in the UX research team and help us build international research at Mews. Become an ambassador for UX deep insights and supporter of quantitative and qualitative projects.
**Collaborative mate**
* Alongside with UXR team collaborate closely with other teams and stakeholders to empower their work and help them reach company goals.
* Great communicator that can share insights in a clear, actionable way as well as fostering engagement and drive UXR adoption.
**Contextual master**
* Ability to see the stories in the data and articulate them. The key is to work with multiple sources of data.
* Ability to see the bigger picture (strategic thinking) and being able to zoom-in and zoom-out accordingly in every stage of the research process.
**Innovator and Strategist**
* Passion and hunger for learning new things are essential as well as implementing them and sharing experiences. Love experimenting with methodological approaches and tools to do it.
Extra points for a hospitality knowledge. We all travel, you can expect discussions and tips for your future trips
**✅ Your mission, should you choose to accept it:**

* **Quantitative Analysis**: Conduct data-driven analyses to understand customer behaviour, preferences, and pain points. Leverage statistical tools and methodologies to extract insights from large datasets. Proficient in SQL, Python / R, and data visualization software.
* **KPI Measurement**: Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) related to customer satisfaction, loyalty, and retention.
* **Predictive Modelling**: Develop predictive models to forecast customer behaviour and inform strategic decisions.
* **Data Visualization**: Present findings and recommendations through clear visualizations and reports.
* **Customer Journey Mapping**: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to map out end-to-end customer journeys, identifying touchpoints and pain areas as well as opportunities.
* **Segmentation and Personalization**: Use mixed-method research to segment customer groups and tailor personalized experiences.
* **Stakeholder Management**: Work closely with product managers, UX designers, product marketing and data science teams to align CX strategies with business goals.
**️ You'll be a great fit if you bring a few of the below with you:**
* Experience with online research tools (Looker, Gainsight, Useberry, Userinterviews, Dovetail)
* Comprehensive experience as a mixed method Customer Experience Researcher
* Education: Economics, Sociology, Anthropology, Psychology... with a focus on customer experience research, data analysis and visualization.
* Experience with CX strategy and measurement, VoC.
* Experience with Participatory Design and Innovation frameworks.
* Experience with Ethnographic research and other qualitative methods, trend analysis, benchmarking, competitive analysis
* Education: Master's or Ph.D. in a quantitative field (e.g., Sociology, Statistics, Economy, Marketing).
* Experience: Comprehensive experience with mixed method research within a relevant industry (e.g., travel, commodity trading, finance, tech)
**Technical Skills**:
* Proficiency in Python or R (backend and frontend development).
* Familiarity with SQL for data extraction and manipulation.
* Sound statistical skills.
* Experience with data analytics tools.
* Experience with Ethnography and qualitative methods
**Soft Skills**:
* Analytical mindset.
* Innovative problem-solving.
* Strong communication and collaboration abilities.
* Stakeholder management.
**What to expect when it comes to hiring:**
The number of rounds and their order is not written in stone, but in most cases, you can expect:
* **Initial interview (** 30min)
This is the right place to get to know each other, understand motivation & outline expectations.
* **Technical interview + Team-fit (** 60min, typically 20min per case study)
So let's dive together into your case studies: how you tackle challenges, the design research process, your role, and to understand the outputs and impact you made or lessons learned you took.
* **Final decision**
Sometimes, you can meet more people during the interview process, such as our founder or CPO, within these sessions or as a separate call.
###  **What's in it for you?**

Did you know that Mews was voted the Best PMS of 2024 and has previously held the title of Best Place to Work in Hotel Tech for two consecutive years? You do now. Most of that is down to our inspiring team, but part of it is because of some pretty amazing perks. As well as awesome colleagues and stimulating work, you'll get:
* Participation in the Company shares program
* Best-in-class Parental Leave Policy. At Mews, as the primary caregiver you get 6 months of fully paid parental leave, and as a secondary caregiver, you get 2 months of fully paid parental leave.
(No matter your location, this can be used during the 1st year and applies if you've been employed for at least 1 year at Mews)
* Flexible Benefits via the ThanksBen platform
* Unlimited paid holiday (no, this is not a typo)
* Wellness Wednesday's (once a month, the whole company enjoys a day where you can attend to your own well-being)
* Remote/flexible working (we're 100% hybrid-proof, but we cannot hire from anywhere in the world unfortunately, so feel free to reach out and check with us!)
* Monthly working from home allowance and a monthly healthcare insurance allowance (we want you to be happy & healthy)
* Regular team events and socials
#### **Who is Mews?**

We want to get to know you, so it's only fair we tell you a little bit about ourselves first. Mews has been transforming hospitality since 2012. What began in a single hotel in Prague now powers thousands of hotels around the world, as they pursue their mission to develop transformational solutions for brands and create remarkable experiences for guests.

Since the beginning, Mews embraced being different. Mews is not simply a property management system, but a connected hospitality cloud with products across the hotel ecosystem and more integrations than anyone else.

From global hospitality brands to independent properties, hoteliers join Mews because they recognize the power of innovation. They understand that they can benefit from hotel tech that drives efficiency, maximizes revenue, and improves guest happiness.

Powering over 5,000 customers across more than 85 countries, Mews Hospitality Cloud is designed to streamline operations for modern hoteliers, transform the guest experience and create more profitable businesses.

Ranked 24th in the FT 1000 list of the fastest-growing European companies in 2021, Mews has been recognized as the Best PMS by industry peers at the HotelTechAwards in both 2020 and 2024, consistently earning acclaim. Mews also achieved finalist status in 2021 and 2022. What's more, we take immense pride in being listed among the Best Places to Work in Hotel Tech during those same years and again this year. But our achievements don't stop there
column2: Mews was also listed among the World's Best Hotel PMS Provider 2023 and as the World's Best Independent Hotel PMS Provider 2022 and 2023 by the World Travel Tech Awards.

column1: #### **Life at Mews**

That's what we do, but what about who we are? Mews' culture is special and difficult to capture in words, which makes writing this tricky. You'll experience the freedom to be yourself and the ability to watch your ideas come to life. You'll have an open line of communication and an open invitation to after-work drinks, be they virtual or in-person. Sometimes the work can be challenging and there can be a lot of it, but you'll always be able to rely on those around you.

Yes, we're ambitious and we move fast, but we know the value of fun and taking a breather. Every month we have a Wellness Wednesday, a day off that you can use to boost your health, whether that's a long lie-in, a trip to the gym, or anything in between. We have slack channels for almost every interest imaginable, and an all-company meeting every Friday gives you the chance to ask any question to our leadership team.
To get more of an idea what life at Mews is like, check out our Instagram .
We're guided by our five key values
column2: if you see yourself in them, it's time to get in touch.

column1: #### **Everyone is welcome at Mews**

To reimagine the art of hospitality, we need teams who represent our global and diverse customers and users. Our differences make Mews, so we welcome people of all backgrounds and identities to work with us. Embracing different perspectives, trying new things and feeling safe to bring your authentic self to work. If this sounds like you and you're ready to join a global, innovative, and exciting community, we'd love to hear from you!

One very important note….don't hold back! Even if you think you don't meet 100% of the criteria listed in this job role, we still encourage you to apply. We believe that everyone should have equal access to opportunities and want to ensure we provide an inclusive experience, so do let us know if there is anything else we can do to support your application process. https://nl.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=7b75905f43f1c15f,indeed,Data Analyst/Scientist RaboResearch Food & Agribusiness,Rabobank,https://nl.indeed.com/cmp/Rabobank,"Utrecht, UT, NL",fulltime,2024-07-03,,,,,False,,,"Hosang.wu@rabobank.com, cindy.koolhout@rabobank.com, lex.verwayen@rabobank.nl","s Data Analyst/Scientist Food & Agribusiness at RaboResearch F&A you, together with more than 70 F&A colleagues globally, generate data-driven insights, (proprietary) data sets, and models, which are used for our research, publication client meetings, and the bank itself.
**You and your job**

As a Data Analyst/Scientist Food & Agribusiness, you’ll work together with other F&A data analysts/scientists and more than 70 Global F&A Analysts from different regions (e.g. Australia New Zealand, North America, South America, and Asia) and Europe and sectors (e.g. Animal Protein, Dairy, Fresh Produce, Consumer Foods, Grain & Oilseeds) and related themes (e.g. Climate, Nature), the bank’s highly valued F&A knowledge centre. The models/data and insights generated are crucial for the bank and clients to maintain and develop their businesses (strategy).
**PracticalExamples**
* Develop, maintain, and help improve unique data sets, models, and tools to support stakeholders and clients.
* As a team player you collaborate with F&A experts and stakeholders to turn their knowledge and needs into data models, tools, and insights
* Proactively participate in modelling and data analytical initiatives
* Proactively contribute to F&A research projects and publications together with F&A analysts
* Our insights are presented to our wholesale and rural clients' prospects and press, and most are published via Rabobank Knowledge Hub.
**Facts & Figures**
* 36 hours per week
* Work together with 180 analysts (researchers and data analyst and scientists) of which 70 in Food & Agribusiness
* Part of an international and diverse F&A research & data team in Europe and Africa
* 43,822 Rabobank colleagues around the world
**Top responsibilities**

* Work closely together with F&A analysts and fulfil research needs with efficient or innovative solutions. Think along and challenge domain experts in the creation of unique research using your technical knowledge.
* Clearly define the objectives and timelines of your projects and the steps to take. Share the progress and project results with your main stakeholders regularly.
**Together we achieve more than alone**

We believe in the power of difference. Bringing together people's differences is what makes us an even better bank. So we are very curious about what you can bring to our Global RaboResearch F&A team:

Hosang: *“Being part of RaboResearch allows you to work on major topics that impact the food value chain and (in)directly society and the world as a whole. You will have a great time here if you enjoy connecting with stakeholders and providing hands-on solutions that bring new insights to the table.”*

Together with the other three F&A data analysts/scientists you are part of the RaboResearch F&A Europe and Africa team (In total 20 FTE) and one of our data analysts is located in our North America team. All 5 Data experts (including you) work closely together with the F&A analysts, providing our clients with the newest sector insights, creating ‘order from chaos’. You will focus on the support of one or more Global F&A sector teams. RaboResearch has a Global Matrix structure in place (regions vs. sectors).
Working together is the way we work
column2: as 1 results-driven, analytical, and pragmatic team at Rabobank. Talking of Rabobank: We are a Dutch bank that operates in 38 countries for over 9,500,000 customers. Together with these customers, our members, and partners we stand side by side to create a world in which everyone has access to enough healthy food and green energy. In the Netherlands we work to create a country in which people are happy with how they live, work and do business.

column1: **You and your talent**

Ideally, we are looking for an Agricultural or Applied Economist with Data skills – in practical terms, you've built maintainable analytical models in Python that have been used to look at topics at any stage along the value chain from production-based ag to the consumer foods sector (farm to fork). Projects will include working on sector based models to cultivating proprietary data and tools (e.g. dashboards).

The team practice is a hybrid between agile and consulting – a person who thrives will take complex problems, break them into parts, and deliver the highest value-added first. Evaluation will be based on an interview, a code sample, and a technical presentation.
* A solid foundation of statistics, preferably agricultural econometrics, and modelling. (for example MSc in business information management, agricultural or applied economy, econometry)
* An enthusiastic team player, who is willing to embrace and share knowledge and expertise
* Initiates improvements and contributes to their realization and can set up data research autonomously following the research question
* Strong interpersonal skills to build and maintain relationships within and outside RaboResearch and to communicate research results effectively to clients and (internal) stakeholders

* Involved in identifying and advising on complex insights, modelling experience (foundational/intermediate level )in real-life business settings with traditional (structural/econometrics) and algorithmic (statistical/Bayesian) approaches
* Experience in Azure-based environments, strong hands-on programming skills (Python) and experience in setting up data pipelines
* Fluent in English, both verbally and in writing. Proficiency in Dutch is considered an advantage
**This is what we offer you**
* Basic salary from € 3,711 up to € 6.168 gross per month (scale 8 or 9, depending on your experience)

* On top: thirteenth month's salary, 8% holiday allowance and an extra budget of 10% (scale 8) or 11% (scale 9) of your gross salary to be used at your discretion. Buy extra holiday hours, add more to your pension savings or ask for part of the extra budget to be paid out.
* a combination of working from home (3 days) and at the office (2 days)
This is a selection of the terms of employment for Data Analyst/Scientist based on a 36-hour working week. You can find all terms of employment on rabobank.jobs/en/conditions-of-employment.
**You and the job application process**

* Any questions about the job content? Contact: Hosang Wu, Data Scientist, via Hosang.wu@rabobank.com, or Cindy Koolhout, Head RaboResearch F&A Europe & Africa, via cindy.koolhout@rabobank.com or +31620604124
* Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Please contact Lex Verwayen, Corporate Recruiter, via lex.verwayen@rabobank.nl

* An assignment will be part of the process. With the assignment we want to test your modeling and coding skills as well as your capability to explain a complex question and solution to colleagues with no data science skills.
* You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on rabobank.jobs/en/faq
* A security check is part of the process
* We respect your privacy

https://nl.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=d28652aee8a434d3,indeed,Business Engineer – Improvement Engineering,ASML,https://nl.indeed.com/cmp/Asml,"Eindhoven, NB, NL",fulltime,2024-07-03,,,,,False,,,,"**Introduction to the job**

The focus of the semiconductor industry (and other industries simultaneously) is more and more on a green environment and circular economy. ASML is committed to play a strong role in this. Are you triggered by this, do you want to contribute to a greener environment while working in a multinational in the semiconductor business?

Do you have strong data analytic background? Do you want to contribute to transform waste to valuable reusable material ? We are looking for people like you to join our Improvement Engineering group in Reuse engineering
**Job Mission**
The Improvement engineering group in Re-Use Engineering department, In this role you translate data to information to support correct business decision making in the R&R engineering department.
**Job Description**
Your main responsibilities are:
* Analyze business insight/performance/requests to translate the information to actionable improvement solution proposal.
* Support decision making process for solution provider selections
* Consult business insight developer with business knowledge on data.
* Think along and drive improvement solution with reuse engineering staffs and project leads
* Interface with internal & external customers to collect their demand and translate it to requirement. Recommend how the requirement can be translated to usable business insight.
* Maintain and secure data integrity of analysis and report.
**Education and experience**
* BS degree in Data Science, Analytics, Engineering, Business, Finance, Computer Science or equivalent education experience.
* 3+ years of working experience as a Data Analyst/Analytics Developer including experience building Analytical products for internal consumption (E.g. Dashboards, automatic analysis, algorithms,).
* Experienced with IT-systems in the area of production-control, preferably with Spotfire, Tableau, Power BI (Excel, SAP, SAP ME/BO, SAP HANA), SQL, Python and Alteryx
* Experience with advanced analytics (e.g. Process Mining, Machine Learning, AI, Imagine recognition, etc)
* Stakeholder management.
* Experience within semi-conductor industry including ASML experience is a plus.
**Skills**

Working at the cutting edge of tech, you’ll always have new challenges and new problems to solve – and working together is the only way to do that. You won’t work in a silo. Instead, you’ll be part of a creative, dynamic work environment where you’ll collaborate with supportive colleagues. There is always space for creative and unique points of view. You’ll have the flexibility and trust to choose how best to tackle tasks and solve problems.
To thrive in this job, you’ll need the following skills:
* Proactive and Pragmatic, likes to challenge the status quo
* Strong analytical capability
* To be flexible and enjoy working in a rapidly changing environment
* Team player with excellent communication skills in a multicultural work environment
* Enjoy working with various stakeholders both worldwide and cross sector
* Strong drive and able to influence stakeholders without power
* Flexibly change needed role between expert and leader and accept needed work per situations
**Other information**
Please submit your CV and motivation letter when applying for this role.

The Business Engineer works in small expert teams closely working with field and cross sector stakeholders, reporting to Improvement Engineering Manager, flexibility in assignment/projects is required as the Re-Use scope is developing/growing over time

https://nl.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=062a9f734c7b8b23,indeed,Consultant Data Transformation & Migration,KPMG,https://nl.indeed.com/cmp/Kpmg-0828bc85,"Amstelveen, NH, NL",,2024-07-03,,,,,False,,,,"Are you a driven professional that would like to discover business and data transformations in detail in the wider context of technology? Are you willing to develop yourself both on the personal and technical aspects and are you likely to enjoy supporting our clients in their transformations and migrations? Would you like to be part of a young, growing and ambitious 'Powered Data' team and continuously develop yourself? Then we invite you to apply for the position Consultant Data Transformation & Migration at KPMG!
Your challenges
* Support the delivery (data migration) of large scale organizations
* Work in a broader team of professionals in which you will have plenty of opportunities to develop yourself as a professional
* Identify improvement opportunities and foster innovation in the context of data transformation and migration
* Join a growing team that is heavily investing in data migration and has fun helping clients on their (ERP) transformation journeys
This is what you bring
* 1-2 years of work experience in a relevant context (e.g. Migration consultant, Technical consultant, Junior engineer, Junior developer, Data analyst)
* Willingness to learn and improve in technical skills
* Affinity with the concepts of ERP architectures (SAP and/or Microsoft Dynamics 365), data modelling and data management
* Intrinsic motivation to work on large scale, complex projects
* Any proficiency in coding languages such as Java, SQL, Python, Dax and any other coding languages is preferred (not mandatory)
* Fluency in English and Dutch, spoken and written.
* You are flexible to travel internationally for your clients

*\* These criteria are an indication of the profile we are looking for. Research shows that male candidates often apply when they see a 60% match with the profile, while women only apply when they see a 100% match. If you don't meet all the criteria but you do believe that this is the right position for you, we kindly invite you to apply anyway or get in touch.*What will you do in this position?

Ongoing technological advancements have a significant impact on various sectors and are constantly challenging organizations to keep up with rapidly changing market conditions. In order to keep up with the speed of technology and to remain competitive, organizations are embarking on business and data transformation projects. And transforming the business entails transforming your data. Easier said than done as data transformation is complex and multi-dimensional.

Within the KPMG Powered Data Migration team, we make use of our proven global end-to-end Powered transformation methodology and by doing so, we effectively and efficiently deliver business and data transformations.

We are looking for several eager consultants that can support us in this delivery and that would like to be part of a highly motivated and growing team. As a consultant, you will be part of the Powered Data Migration team. This is a young, ambitious, and rapidly growing team working on large and complex data transformations and migrations. You will be a full-fledged member of the team from the beginning, getting hands-on with our clients' data. In short, we are looking for a curious, passionate, and driven colleague who wants to strengthen our ambitious team!

As consultant Data Transformation you will be working client facing from early days already and work shoulder-to-shoulder with business and data teams on large projects, taking a lot of responsibility early on. You may be able to present the outcomes of your work in no-time, supported by your team members and manager. Typical projects where you will be part of are ERP transformations, M&A projects and/or specific data migration projects with a defined scope (this could be replacement of systems, data migration driven by regulatory requirements etc.). These projects all have ‘Data’ as a critical condition for success and hence ‘Data’ will lie in the heart of your daily work.
This is what we offer
* Competitive salary, a bonus, a fixed expense allowance and a working from home allowance.
* 30 vacation days (on a full-time basis) and the option to buy more days or sell your vacation days.
* A lease car + NS business card or mobility allowance.
* A laptop and iPhone which also can be used privately.
* Pension accrual without a compulsory personal contribution.
* Choice to pick from different courses which contribute to your own personal and professional development.

https://nl.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=de92244d7e99dead,indeed,Quantitative Engineer - AMD Public MAS Strats - Analyst - The Hague,Goldman Sachs,https://nl.indeed.com/cmp/Goldman-Sachs,"Den Haag, ZH, NL",fulltime,2024-07-03,,,,,False,,,,"Quantitative Engineer - AMD Public MAS Strats - Analyst - The Hague**Goldman Sachs Asset & Wealth Management:**

As one of the world's leading asset managers, our mission is to help our clients achieve their investment goals. To best serve our clients' diverse and evolving needs, we have built our business to be global, broad and deep across asset classes, geographies and solutions.

Goldman Sachs Asset & Wealth Management is one of the world's leading asset management institutions. AWM delivers innovative investment solutions managing close to Two Trillion US Dollars on a global, multi-product platform. In addition to traditional products (e.g. Equities, Fixed Income) our product offering also includes Hedge Funds, Private Equity, Fund of Funds, Quantitative Strategies, Fundamental Equity and a Multi-Asset Pension Solutions Business. Software is engineered in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, adapting to market and customer needs to deliver robust solutions in an ever-changing business environment.
**What We Do**

Multi-Asset Solutions, ""MAS"" is an investing group within the Asset Management Division at Goldman Sachs. MAS is responsible for managing customized multi-asset class portfolios and funds, including discretionary mandates for US and international public pension plans, sovereign wealth funds and insurance companies and providing outsourced CIO services. The team is comprised of professionals with deep and varied investment backgrounds who specialize in designing and implementing customized multi-asset class portfolios.

Our Engineering and Strategist teams are responsible for building portfolio management and asset allocation tools to help our portfolio managers and clients make critical investment decisions for multi-billion dollar portfolios. We also build quantitative models that underpin our investment philosophy and process.
**Who We Look For**

We are looking for quantitative engineers to join our Strats team to help with core initiatives to deliver our next-generation digital experience to internal and external users using open source tools and frameworks. Our goal is to build scalable, extensible tools that have immediate impact on a growing user base and will serve our needs in the long term to outperform our competitors. We are a fun, entrepreneurial team that loves coding, investing, and turning our ideas into reality. We are looking for creative, self-driven developers who want to grow and learn from others in a fast-paced environment. The ideal candidate has a strong mix of software engineering and quantitative backgrounds. You have a track record with JavaScript front and back-end frameworks or Python. You enjoy working with end users to understand the problem at hand and help design the solution, and are excited to learn about investment finance and portfolio management concepts. You will engineer software across all phases of the software development life cycle: partnering with MAS investing professionals to design new features, building those features, creating, and running tests, receiving feedback, and delivering enhancements.
**Requirements**
* Bachelors, Masters or equivalent experience in computer science, mathematics or engineering
* Meaningful experience in, but not limited to, any of the following: Javascript frameworks (React/Angular/Node), MongoDB/NoSQL, SQL, Python
* Strong knowledge of data structures, algorithms and object oriented programming
* Strong communication skills, ability to work on a fast-paced team and collaborate with stakeholders and end users
* Knowledge of or interest in learning investment finance, portfolio theory and analytics (portfolio optimization, simulation or glidepath)
* 1-2+ years of relevant work experience
ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS

At Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869, we are a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York, we maintain offices around the world.

We believe who you are makes you better at what you do. We're committed to fostering and advancing diversity and inclusion in our own workplace and beyond by ensuring every individual within our firm has a number of opportunities to grow professionally and personally, from our training and development opportunities and firmwide networks to benefits, wellness and personal finance offerings and mindfulness programs. Learn more about our culture, benefits, and people at GS.com/careers.

We're committed to finding reasonable accommodations for candidates with special needs or disabilities during our recruiting process. Learn more: https://www.goldmansachs.com/careers/footer/disability-statement.html

Our digital asset management platform enables teams to conquer the chaos of proliferating content, touchpoints, and relationships in order to thrive.

With powerful and intuitive solutions that embrace the way people want to work, and a richly integrated ecosystem, We are the brand ally that unifies and transforms the creation and sharing of assets, inspiring teams, delighting customers, and elevating businesses.

Our 500+ employees, known as 'Byndies', together constitute the world's most extensive pool of digital asset management expertise. We enable more than 1.7M users across more than 3,700 organizations, including Spotify, Puma, Five Guys and Icelandair.
Founded in 2013, we have eight offices around the globe, including the Netherlands, USA, Spain, UK, Australia and UAE. For more information, visit www.bynder.com.

Bynder's Internal Analytics platform is essential for streamlining our product and business growth by providing best-in-class data and insights to our stakeholders precisely when they need it. We are looking for a skilled **Data Analyst** who will contribute to the technical and analytical efforts of our team, ensuring data-driven decisions and solutions.
### **Responsibilities**
**Data Analysis:** Conduct thorough data analysis to extract meaningful insights, identify trends, and support decision-making processes across the organization.

**Product Analytics**: Conduct in-depth product analytics to identify key trends, user behaviors, and areas for improvement. Collaborate with product teams to drive data-informed decisions and enhance overall product performance.
**Report Generation:** Develop and maintain reports, dashboards, and visualizations using tools like DBT, Snowflake, and ThoughtSpot to provide stakeholders with actionable insights.

**Collaboration:** Work closely with internal stakeholders to understand their data needs and provide solutions that drive business value. Collaborate with other teams in Bynder's Data Group to ensure data consistency and accuracy.

**Technical Contribution:** Utilize your technical skills to manage and manipulate large datasets, ensuring data quality and integrity. Stay updated with the latest industry trends and tools to continuously improve our data practices.
### **Qualifications**
**Experience**: Minimum of 3 years in data analytics, with hands-on experience in analyzing and interpreting complex data sets.
**Technical Skills**: Proficiency in SQL and Python is essential. Experience in DBT, data warehouses (e.g. Snowflake) or machine learning is a plus.
**Communication**: Strong communication skills to effectively convey insights and collaborate with team members and stakeholders.
**Collaboration:** Demonstrated ability to work with internal stakeholders and engineers to deliver exceptional outputs.

Join us to leverage your analytical expertise to drive Bynder's growth through data and analytics. If you have a passion for data and an aptitude for technical problem-solving, we want to hear from you!
### **Why you'll love Bynder!**

At Bynder, innovation is in our DNA. We've worked hard to build an environment that promotes creative thinking and self-initiative within a culture of fun. It's common to find colleagues hanging out after work - if you believe in ""be nice, work hard, have fun"", you'll have an office full of friends.
### **What we have:**
* Challenging and inspiring work environment
* Flat hierarchy where your voice will be truly heard
* Opportunity to initiate your own projects
* An experienced team is ready to welcome you anytime
* Unlimited vacation policy
* Competitive monthly compensation
* Apple gear
* Daily lunch
* Drinks at the Bynder Bar :-)
* Amazing office in the heart of Amsterdam
### **Our Commitment:**

Bynder Love is the principle that guides the way we grow our teams, support our employees, and celebrate our differences. At Bynder we strive to create a culture that embraces every Byndie because differences in background, experience, and perspective make Bynder even better. At Bynder a diverse, inclusive, and equitable workplace is one where all employees, whatever their ethnicity, color, sex, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or physical and mental ability are valued and respected. Our commitment is for all Byndies to have the freedom to be their true authentic selves.
Just as we are never finished innovating, Bynder's commitment to being An Even Better Bynder is a constant, evolving commitment that includes education, listening, and action.

Northpool has four trading desks: an intraday desk, short term, long term and algorithmic trading. All these trading desks need their crucial data to make the best trading decisions, each trading desk has its own requirements that must be taken into account. Our trading desks are supported by the Operations, Data & Analytics department, which also includes our Data Engineers.

All dashboards, models and databases are built internally by us. Our team of Data Engineers collects the data and ensures that it is processed correctly so that the Data Scientists and Analysts can use it to build models and tools.

As a Medior Data Engineer, in addition to programming, you will be responsible for coaching/supervising the Junior Data Engineers and transferring knowledge within the organization. You will be asked to think along about new developments that are needed and how we can further optimize the various data flows.
Your challenge?

Ensuring that the data flows are set up as optimally as possible, monitoring the quality of the data and creating the conditions for the team of Data Engineers to be self-reliant. Ensure that the team, despite everyone’s personal working methods, has the same standards and speaks the same ‘language’. Thinking along with seniors and leads from various departments to improve design in data architecture.
For this position, we are looking for a Medior Data Engineer to support the short-term and day-ahead trading desk. You will be part of the agile team that develops solutions that support trading.
**WE ASK:**
* A MSc degree in Computer Science
* At least 2 years of relevant work experience
* At least 2 years of experience with Python and 2 years of experience with SQL
* Knowledge of data warehousing architectures
* Experience with building data pipelines
* Capability of translating business logic to technical solutions
* Good social and communication skills
* A strong sense of responsibility and a willingness to take ownership of your work.

* Experience with Docker
* Interest or experience in working with realtime data streaming
* Interest in back-end programming
* Pro-active and flexible work mentality
* Interest in Trading
* Experience in working with Snowflake and/or Kafka
* Experience with Microsoft Azure
**WE OFFER:**
* Training, continuous learning and development opportunities
* Annual performance-based bonus
* A non-hierarchical workplace
* Young and highly motivated teammates
* Ownership in your work
* A fun, international workplace
* Plenty of social events!
Location: for this vacancy we need you to live in The Netherlands. Also, the application procedure will take place at our office in Leiden.
To enhance collaboration in a dynamic trading environment you will partly be working at the trading desk, close to our traders. Therefore, you would be working in the office 4 days a week.

https://nl.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=a0aa773cefdb9f9d,indeed,Senior BI Specialist,Exact,https://nl.indeed.com/cmp/Exact-9,"Delft, ZH, NL",,2024-07-02,,,,,True,,,,"(Sr.) Professional Job Netherlands, Delft Corporate Functions Netherlands

As a Senior BI Specialist, you participate and provide input for data integration, transformation of multiple data source systems, develop data warehouses with a combination of business intelligence, data visualization and reporting tools. Next to this, you advocate self-service analytics and will give training sessions to empower the business to build their own reports, dash boards and power BI models. At Exact, your technical skills and “dare to” mentality, can lead to the best innovations. And where is your career heading? That’s up to you. The career opportunities are unprecedented. 2000 enterprising colleagues have already paved the way. Are you on board?
**This = the job you are looking for:**
* Provide expert guidance on Business Intelligence (BI) skills and technologies.
* Develop scalable and maintainable BI applications to meet business objectives.
* Develop security and authentication standards for the department.
* Maintain accurate and complete technical architectural documents.
* Define BI standards, guidelines and best practices for business groups and technical teams.
* Support BI tools upgrades in development, testing and documentation.
* Perform maintenance and troubleshooting activities for BI tools.
* Diagnose and resolve BI tool capacity issues.
* Recommend strategies to improve performance and capacity of BI tools.
* Address customer queries and issues in a timely manner.
* Provide technical training on BI tools to team members.
* Collaborate with BI Administrators, Developers and Analysts for successful development of BI reporting and analysis solutions.
* Work with business groups and technical teams to develop and maintain data warehouse platform for BI reporting.
* Design and build tabular models writing complex DAX formulae.
* Build scalable data warehouse solutions using PaaS and SaaS services in Microsoft cloud.
* Address master data issues and provide data solutions to manage them.

You will join the 6 colleagues in the Corporate BI department. They are known for their great technical knowledge and smooth cooperation. Asking for help if necessary and offering help if possible is part of their DNA. We have few predefined paths, which gives you plenty of room to choose your own.
**The main responsibilities of the department are:**

* Key operations of the business intelligence team begin with the design and deployment of the BI architecture, which includes source systems, data warehouses, and a combination of business intelligence, data visualization, and reporting tools.
* Advocate self-service analytics and train to empower Business to build their own reports, dash boards and power BI models.
* Agree to SLA’s for providing front line support to the business users on the BI cubes and deliver big fixes and enhancements on a timely basis.
**This = what you bring**

With us, you can be yourself, and we would love to discover what sets you apart. For the position of Senior BI Specialist, it’s helpful if you have analytical skills and that you have good communications skills. What’s more, you bring:
* Microsoft suite of BI tools (Both On-premises and Cloud)
* Relevant experience in building data warehouse solutions in cloud using PaaS and SaaS services.
* Around 10 or more years of experience
* Reporting tools, mainly Power BI
* Data modeling, data warehousing, data visualization & analytics
* Programming languages like Python, .net, R would be added value.
**This = what you get**

At Exact we value the balance between work and relaxation. You can work up a sweat in our own gym or take a break at the coffee bar. Empty your head and then tackle your daily tasks with renewed energy. And, of course, that's not all. As a Senior BI Specialist, based on 40 hours per week, you can also count on:
* A competitive salary package incl. a 13th month and of course 8% holiday allowance
* An international, innovative and hybrid working environment, with the flexibility to work from home or any of our offices
* Over 2000 colleagues worldwide of which more than 500 in technology.
* 27 vacation days and in addition, loyalty days
column2: one for each year in service with a max of 5

column1: * 3 Giving back days, which can spend on giving back to (local) community
* A modern pension scheme
* All the room your ambition needs and to further develop your skills we facilitate training via our learning and development center to help you to fulfill your career potential
* Friday afternoon drinks at our bar “Bits & Bytes”
**About Exact**

Exact develops cloud software for small and medium-sized companies and their accountants. The products automate business processes in areas such as Finance and HR and provide specific ERP solutions for wholesale distribution, manufacturing, projects and construction. This saves time and provides insight. It enables customers to work efficiently, make informed decisions and continue growing. More than 675,000 companies primarily in the Netherlands, Belgium and Germany already rely on Exact's software.

Exact was founded in 1984 in Delft, the Netherlands, which is still the location of our head office. Every day, more than 2,000 ambitious professionals work on innovation. Driving responsible business, with respect for each other, the environment and society is central to this. For more information, visit www.exact.com.
Contact Arthur Fransen

This role, reporting to the global co-heads of private equity, is integral to advancing our digitalization vision.**

### **Dit wordt je functie**
**Functieomschrijving**
**Job description:**

As a Quant Developer, you will play a pivotal role in shaping and executing our data & analytics strategy, leveraging and optimizing our existing data architecture. Key responsibilities include streamlining data ingestion, integrating relevant (big) data sources, collaborating with the business on decision-making, analyzing complex datasets, developing machine learning models, and providing actionable insights to drive strategic business decisions.
This position is ideal for candidates with a strong quantitative background, offering an exciting opportunity to contribute to our business growth.
**Dit ga je doen**
**Main Duties and Responsibilities:**
* Contribute to the development of the digitalization vision within Private Equity.
* Enhance data pipelines, visualizations (graphs), and analytical tools for increased professionalism.
* Conduct thematic research with a quantitative focus on pertinent topics to evaluate the impact on the investment portfolio.
* Transform research findings into robust analytics with minimal maintenance requirements.
**Dit breng je mee**
**Job Requirements:**
* Master’s degree or higher with high distinction in quantitative methods, mathematics, or a related statistical/data-oriented field from a top-tier school.
* Relevant experience as a quant developer or quantitative analyst.
* Proficiency in programming languages, particularly Python.
* Experience with SQL and data manipulation libraries (e.g., Pandas, NumPy).
* Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Dash).
* Strong problem-solving and communication skills.
* Long-term value creation mindset: broad-minded, innovative, forward-thinking.
* Ability to collaborate effectively with internal and external stakeholders.
* Adaptability and willingness to address a diverse range of demands.
* Profound knowledge of English language.
* Willing to undertake occasional regional travel.
**Dit bieden wij**
**What APG has to offer**
We offer you a competitive monthly salary based on 40-hours and attractive terms of employment with a
focus on flexibility.
* A guaranteed year-end bonus of 8.33%
* A target driven bonus scheme
* Ample attention to your vitality and personal development
* Ability to grow your professional network, internally as well as externally
* Working from home for 2 to 3 days, and also working from one of our beautiful offices
* And of course a well-organized pension.
For pension provider APG, pensions are about people, life and how we live together. Through careful asset
management, pension administration, communication and advice, APG wants to help building a decent
future in which we share our well-being and prosperity honestly and sustainably. For present and future
generations. For today, tomorrow and beyond.
APG is committed to serving 4.7 million people in the Netherlands. That explains the importance we attach
to reflecting Dutch society. To that end, APG strives for an inclusive work environment in which everyone
can be themselves and their unique qualities are embraced.
Choosing APG means choosing a job in which you contribute to a bright future. Don’t delay, apply today! **Meer informatie**
**More information**

For more information please feel free to reach out to Carlos Garcia Rivas. You can contact him via the following e-mail address: carlos.garciarivas@apg-am.nl. If you have any other question, please contact our recruiter Roy Tholen, roy.tholen@apg.nl.
A Pre-Employment Screening is part of the procedure.
