https://nl.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=5a674dccdc329aa6,indeed,Staff Software Engineer (Backend),JWP (JW Player),https://nl.indeed.com/cmp/Jwp-(jw-Player),"Eindhoven, NB, NL",fulltime,2024-07-03,,,,,True,,,,"**About JWP:**

JWP is the leading video software and data insights platform that gives our customers independence and control in today's Digital Video Economy. Founded over a decade ago as an open-source video player, JWP's technology platform now powers digital video for hundreds of thousands of businesses across NA, EMEA, APAC, and LATAM. Each month, there are over 1 billion viewers across 2.7 billion unique devices consuming video on JWP's technology.
**Remote Policy:**

At JWP, we have adopted a remote work policy, with all our employees working remotely. While we value remote work, we can only consider candidates who are currently located within the country of the job posting. Regrettably, candidates outside of the country of posting will not be considered, and JWP does not provide relocation assistance. This policy is aligned with our operational setup.
**The Engineering Team:**

Our Engineering team plays a big part in the company's success through the development of innovative technologies. Engineers at JWP are passionate about writing code and solving complex problems. Equipped with a modern tech stack, our Engineers contribute to helping drive monetization for our customers across billions of devices monthly.
**The Opportunity:**

Backend Engineers at JWP contribute to the development of innovative video-focused technology products that service clients around the world. We are looking for an experienced Backend Engineer to join our team in the Netherlands. This is a Staff level opportunity to come on board to use modern technology stacks and work on interesting products within the video space that impact clients across some of the many verticals, such as broadcasting and publishing.
**As a Staff Software Engineer for our Authorization Service, you will:**
* Build a delivery system that can deliver personalized and recommended video metadata at scale.
* Build a system that helps broadcasters to manage their OTT applications across different platforms.
* Optimize the architecture of our delivery services.
* Design the data models and data solutions that we need to power our services.
* Collaborate in a cross-functional team focused on our customers and their viewers experiences.
* Contribute to innovative technology and architecture of a global production-scale service layer.
* Work with microservices and microservice principles (Service discovery, API gateways, data transaction consistency, etc.).
* Make a material impact on our streaming products, analytics, and OTT integrations.
* Participate in code reviews with and mentor your peers.
**Requirements for the role:**
* At least 7 years of relevant experience, with an extensive background in backend development.
* Demonstrable experience of leading technical projects and architecting solutions.
* Proven record of leading cross-team technical projects and architecting and delivering high-quality and impactful technical solutions, demonstrating expertise independent of programming languages.
* Demonstrated experience in scaling systems to the next level to handle increased loads and demands.
* In-depth knowledge of database types, database design and data structures.
* Commitment to code quality, maintainability, readability, scalability, and performance.

https://nl.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=ec7392396c049d23,indeed,IT Infra Automation & Integration Expert,ASML,https://nl.indeed.com/cmp/Asml,"Veldhoven, NB, NL",fulltime,2024-07-03,,,,,True,,,,"Introduction

ASML brings together the most creative minds in science and technology to develop lithography machines that are key to producing faster, cheaper, more energy-efficient microchips. We design, develop, integrate, market and service these advanced machines, which enable our customers – the world’s leading chipmakers – to reduce the size and increase the functionality of their microchips, which in turn leads to smaller, more powerful consumer electronics.
Our headquarters are located in the heart of the Eindhoven region, also known as ‘*Brainport’*, Europe’s top tech hub.

The growing complexity of our machines and our aim to deliver higher quality faster, is creating a lot of focus on the area of Hardware Engineering at ASML. In our department of *Research & Development (R&D) Solution Delivery* we are looking for an experienced Infra Automation & Integration Expert who likes working in a multidisciplinary team and who would like to be part of one of the biggest high-tech communities worldwide.
Job Mission

The IT Infra Automation & Integration Expert for Engineering IT Services will be working on projects as a technical expert or internal consultant. He or she must be able to provide technical leadership to cross functional teams in the design, development and integration of automation solutions into the ASML Engineering IT environment. He or she works in close cooperation with Domain Architects, Application Experts, Infra Coordinator, Subject Matter Experts.

Your mission as part of this team is to contribute towards innovative solutions by automating the repeating manual activities, and to help provide a stable and agile work environment for our (internal) customers.
Job Description
In this position your responsibilities and tasks will entail, but are not limited to:
* Design, implement & support automation use-cases involving IT infrastructure components and engineering applications
* Create automated solutions for the servers we deliver to our internal customers, making use of available automation platforms and components in our Core IT infrastructure
* Work with the IT engineers supporting these components and the automation platform using your scripting knowledge
* Interact with other teams in the Agile Release Train (ART) to understand, develop and implement automation use cases
* Be a strong partner in discussions with Infrastructure architects and other DevOps teams
* Responsible for maintaining the team’s code- and script repositories
* Work according to the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) in a sprint-based workflow, combining plannable and operational activities
* Keep abreast with relevant literature, means and methods.
The Team

You will be part of the *Platform system* team within IT Product & Technology (P&T) Solution Delivery, consisting of 7 people and growing, which is part of the Agile Release Train “Hardware Engineering” of about 40 people.
The team you will be working in:
* Consists of various roles including application support, incident management, technical application management, IT landscape management, architecture, data analytics and process automation
* Supports other teams in the ART, who maintain the applications, with infra related issues and or questions

* Is responsible for the design and maintenance of the Operating systems underneath the applications where our team acts as the service provider of solutions using out of the box IT components such as VDI, ETX, storage, Databases, and cloud.
Education
Minimum Bachelor level or equivalent in Information Technology or Computer Science.
Experience
* 8+ years of proven experience working in complex IT infrastructure environments
* Proven competence in working with automation and CI/CD technologies such as Jenkins, Ansible Tower, Puppet, git, Docker, Kubernetes
* Proven knowledge in one or more scripting languages such as Python, PowerShell
* General knowledge of Engineering IT components as for instance Linux (RedHat), Windows (Server), NetApp storage, security and others
* Good knowledge of IT workplace infrastructure like: Remote Workplace, Windows Server, Citrix XenApp/VDI, ETX(OpenText), Cloud enablement
* Preferably experience with Cloud automation pipelines
* Preferably experience with Splunk
* Knowledge and understanding of services and processes (ITIL, Agile, SAFe)
* Preferably experience in system implementation / change management within production organizations and/or eager to learn in this area.
Personal skills
* Team player, good social skills, service and customer-oriented, ability to motivate people
* Shows initiative and problem solving attitude
* Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, fluent in English spoken and written language
* Independent, accurate, analytical mindset, systematic approach
* Pragmatic, practical, flexible and committed to quality.
Context of the position

At ASML we invent, develop and manufacture world-leading high- tech lithography machines for our chip making customers. These tailor-made machines can image billions of structures in a few seconds with an accuracy of a few silicon atoms. As part of the product development of these complex machines, virtual physics simulation is used to validate the design against certain sets of requirements before moving into physical prototyping and production.
The IT division supports information management, infrastructure and key business processes across ASML. The IT
infrastructure, hardware and applications are absolutely mission-critical for almost all ASML’s internal and external activities.
A department within the IT organization is IT P&T Solution Delivery
column2: this department is responsible for the engineering infrastructure services and applications/tooling for ASML’s Research and Development & Engineering (D&E) organizations. We ensure that these services are running in an optimal way and we look at innovating the services.

column1: IT P&T Solution Delivery supports multiple development disciplines such as: mechanical, optical, electrical and software engineering. The Infra Automation & Integration Expert we are looking for will be part of the SIMS team, supporting mechanical, fluid dynamics and optical Hardware Engineering applications for complete D&E and Research worldwide. You will report to the Group Leader for Hardware Engineering of the *IT R&D Solution Delivery - Hardware* department.
Other information

ASML creates the conditions that enable you to realize your full potential. We provide state-of-the-art facilities, opportunities to develop your talents, international career opportunities, a stimulating and inspiring environment, and most of all, the commitment of a company that recognizes and rewards outstanding performance.
An assessment will be part of the recruitment process. Applications without accompanying motivation letter will not be considered.
Keywords
* CI/CD, ansible, automation, containers, infrastructure, Kubernetes, python, scripting, Windows, Linux

It is the policy of the company to recruit, hire, train and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a driving force in the success of our company.

https://nl.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=08a7f3e4f55e5b8c,indeed,Internship Finance & CX Data Analytics,PostNL,https://nl.indeed.com/cmp/Postnl,"Den Haag, ZH, NL",internship,2024-07-03,,,,,False,,,,"Are you a driven student with a passion for data and finance? Join CBS at PostNL as a Finance & Customer Experience (CX) Data Analytics Intern and make a real impact on our data quality and business insights!
**Uitdagingen**

The business intelligence and analytics team (BI&A) wants to improve the transparency and quality of the data. This requires an analytical mindset and a curious attitude. You will be part of a team that is crucial to making this project a success. The Analytics team has ambitions to help PostNL in creating a data foundation and the quality of the data ingested is crucial for achieving this objective and improve our logistics.

As an intern, your main assignment will be researching the datasets that are part of our ingestion pipeline. You will analyze and shape data quality rules to apply. This will require your own research but you will have the support of the business partners. The goal is to generate the right metrics that will help us in measuring the healthiness of our data.

Although you’ll have the support of the team and experienced engineers, this position will require self-initiative and ability to learn. The bases are set for a solid start but you will have the opportunity to bring your ideas and knowledge with you.
**Furthermore, in this role you will:**
* Ensure data quality and integrity across various financial and customer experience datasets.
* Support the team in various data-driven projects and initiatives.
* Utilize tools like Python, PowerBI, and SQL to extract, analyze, and visualize data.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and implement data-driven improvements.
* Research datasets within our ingestion pipeline and shape data quality rules.
* Generate metrics to measure the healthiness of our data with support from business partners.
**Je verantwoordelijkheden**

**Visible work:** Join PostNL as a Finance & CX Data Analytics Intern and play a key role in enhancing our data quality and business insights. You'll gain hands-on experience with cutting-edge tools like Python, PowerBI, and SQL while working alongside a dedicated analytics team.
**Challenge:** You will help to transform complex financial and customer experience data into actionable insights.
**Good atmosphere:** You work together with colleagues who dare to seize opportunities and help each other move forward.
**Freedom:** You work Hybrid and at our vibrant, state-of-the-art office in the historic Station Post Building (next to Holland Spoor)
**Development Opportunities:** You will have plenty of opportunities to develop yourself and grow into other roles or departments.
**Wat breng jij mee?**

We are looking for someone who is currently pursuing a degree in Data Analytics, Economics, or a related field. You should have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, as these are essential for turning complex data into actionable insights. Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, SQL, and Python is important, as you will be using these tools regularly.

In addition to technical skills, excellent communication and teamwork abilities are crucial. You will be working closely with other team members and stakeholders, so being able to clearly convey your findings and collaborate effectively is key. We also value an eagerness to learn and contribute to the team. If you are enthusiastic about data and driven to make an impact, you will fit right in with our dynamic and supportive work environment.
**In summary, we strongly encourage you to apply for this internship if you bring the following points with you:**
* Currently pursuing a Master’s degree in Data Analytics, Economics, or a related field.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Proficiency in data analysis tools (e.g., Excel, SQL, Python).
* Excellent communication and teamwork skills.
* You are available for a period of 4-6 months from September 2024 onwards.
**Wat bezorgen we jou?**

An innovative internship and work that affects literally every street in the country. PostNL wants to be the logistics e-commerce platform of the future, delivering special moments faster, smarter and better. With your mindset, you can help PostNL face its challenges head on. You can count on excellent benefits in the process.
**The top benefits of your position are:**
* Hybrid working is encouraged and you’ll have flexible working hours. After all, your work-life balance matters to us
* A dynamic and supportive working environment
* Reimbursement of commuting expenses
* Training and development opportunities through the PostNL Academy
* A compeititve internship allowance of €500 based on a 40-hour working week

https://nl.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=a6eccd804a8df7e9,indeed,Machine Learning Engineer Future Model Landscape,DLL Group,https://nl.indeed.com/cmp/Dll-Group,"Eindhoven, NB, NL",,2024-07-03,,,,,True,,,natascha.hooi@dllgroup.com,"**Machine Learning Engineer Future Model Landscape**

What if your expertise as a Machine Learning Engineer Future Model Landscape would help build the data foundation needed to create state of the art predictive models supporting our business and customers every single day? What if your knowledge, skills, and enthusiasm would contribute directly to the success of a global company?
You bridge the gap between business, data and technology. You identify the needs for data of the data scientists and translate them into the right data products.

You will be working in an international team of professionals that have a true passion for what they do. DLL is an IRB financial institution with a unique combination of great opportunities, short reporting lines and broad responsibilities. Data is essential to everything we do, and we rely on dedicated teams of specialists, from data collection to modelling, validation to model implementation. Collaboration is the tool we use to achieve our goals and ambitions. Together, through diversity and inclusion, we will become better at what we do.
Find out more here about how you can unleash your full potential at DLL
**Day to day:**
* As a Machine Learning Engineer Future Model Landscape, you are responsible for the availability and quality of the data for our Risk- and Non-Regulatory Models.
* Together with the team of modelers you decide what data is necessary to successfully develop a model.
* You will investigate if the requested data is already available on the Azure Data Platform.
* If not, you will work closely together with departments in different countries to collect and test the data.
* You will also work closely together with IT to automate the onboarding of the data on the Azure data platform from different applications.
* Next step is to test the quality of the data. If necessary, you will initiate actions together with IT and the application owners to improve the data quality.
* If the necessary data is available and of good quality, you are responsible to transform the data into an integrated model dataset and make it available to the modelers.
* This is an iterative process until the model meets the required performance.
* Together with the team, you are responsible for the data on the data platform and help ensure that there is proper governance around changes in the model data landscape.
* You will also support documentation of data collection and testing activities as well as validation of these activities by the Model Validation team where needed.
* You will provide guidance and support to less experienced team members in the above areas.
* You will, in the above activities, interact with stakeholders from many different teams/departments, such as Predictive Modeling, Data Management, (local) Finance, Sales, and IT.
* You will report to the manager Data Analytics.
**All members enjoy**
* Two working days per year volunteering for a local charity
* Health and Wellness program including healthy food, free health checks, fun health & vitality activities
* Flexible hours with possibility to work from home
* Career development opportunities: online learning, member development programs
* Click this link for an overview of all the benefits in your region.
“We lead the way in meeting the need for flexibility and transparency which our customers increasingly expect”
**Essentials:**
* A Bachelor or Master’s degree in a data- or IT-related field
* 5 - 10 years of professional experience working in a similar role
* Understanding data is a true passion of yours
* Strong written and verbal communication skills
* Proven experience in executing quantitative analyses using SQL and R/Python, and ability to work with MS Excel
* You have a good eye for detail and strong interpersonal skills
* Demonstrated affinity with the development of predictive models
* You are a self-starter and able to work in an organization with a complex system and data landscape
* Strong analytical and project management skills.
**Extras:**
* Knowledge and experience with the application of Agile and Scrum practices
* Experience in working with Microsoft Azure technology and Databricks
* Prior experience working in the Finance industry / credit risk domain and knowledge of relevant regulation
* Preference to work in a dynamic, international environment.
**Choose wellbeing**

DLL’s wellbeing ambition is to educate, equip and empower members to build connections, manage their mental, emotional, physical and financial wellness and maintain balance between work and the other priorities that make up their lives.
Our four wellbeing categories are as follows:
* Connection – Build meaningful connections with other DLL members
* Health – Manage mental, emotional and physical health
* Finance – Provide learning opportunities to help members achieve personal financial health
* Lifestyle – Maintain balance between work and life priorities
These are the things that matter to our members and the wellbeing of our members matters to DLL
**Settling in**

At DLL, we are many things. We are team members, family members, community member. We are members of society, members of different cultures and nationalities. Members of change. We each have different beliefs, different passions, different viewpoints, talents and interests. We come from different backgrounds, cultures, nationalities and histories.
But for all of our differences, we share one thing in common: each of us are members of DLL.

Our company was founded in the Netherlands. But today we are truly a multinational business. Our unique culture is rooted in higher collaboration, less hierarchy and an honest directness that enable us to integrate, ideate and innovate across country lines.
Many companies say they are European, American, Asian or Australian, at DLL we are all these places and more.
We are a cross-culture collaborative – an interconnected network – that comes together every single day with one goal in mind: **Partnering for a better world.**
**Good to know:**
* Deadline for application: July 21st (Due to high volume of applications this requisition may close prior to posted close date)
* The selection process may involve an assessment
* Applications via email will not be reviewed. Please apply online via our career website
* DLL’s referral program applies
* #LI-NA1
* For more information, please contact our Talent acquisition partner Natascha Hooi via natascha.hooi@dllgroup.com.
DLL appreciates the time you spend applying to our openings. We advise only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted. Hiring subject to successful completion of a background check.

DLL is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes and work environments. If contacted for an employment opportunity, please advise Human Resources if you require accommodation in accordance with our values and all applicable legislation.

Goldman Sachs Asset & Wealth Management is one of the world's leading asset management institutions. AWM delivers innovative investment solutions managing close to Two Trillion US Dollars on a global, multi-product platform. In addition to traditional products (e.g. Equities, Fixed Income) our product offering also includes Hedge Funds, Private Equity, Fund of Funds, Quantitative Strategies, Fundamental Equity and a Multi-Asset Pension Solutions Business. Software is engineered in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, adapting to market and customer needs to deliver robust solutions in an ever-changing business environment.
**What We Do**

Multi-Asset Solutions, ""MAS"" is an investing group within the Asset Management Division at Goldman Sachs. MAS is responsible for managing customized multi-asset class portfolios and funds, including discretionary mandates for US and international public pension plans, sovereign wealth funds and insurance companies and providing outsourced CIO services. The team is comprised of professionals with deep and varied investment backgrounds who specialize in designing and implementing customized multi-asset class portfolios.

Our Engineering and Strategist teams are responsible for building portfolio management and asset allocation tools to help our portfolio managers and clients make critical investment decisions for multi-billion dollar portfolios. We also build quantitative models that underpin our investment philosophy and process.
**Who We Look For**

We are looking for quantitative engineers to join our Strats team to help with core initiatives to deliver our next-generation digital experience to internal and external users using open source tools and frameworks. Our goal is to build scalable, extensible tools that have immediate impact on a growing user base and will serve our needs in the long term to outperform our competitors. We are a fun, entrepreneurial team that loves coding, investing, and turning our ideas into reality. We are looking for creative, self-driven developers who want to grow and learn from others in a fast-paced environment. The ideal candidate has a strong mix of software engineering and quantitative backgrounds. You have a track record with JavaScript front and back-end frameworks or Python. You enjoy working with end users to understand the problem at hand and help design the solution, and are excited to learn about investment finance and portfolio management concepts. You will engineer software across all phases of the software development life cycle: partnering with MAS investing professionals to design new features, building those features, creating, and running tests, receiving feedback, and delivering enhancements.
**Requirements**
* Bachelors, Masters or equivalent experience in computer science, mathematics or engineering
* Meaningful experience in, but not limited to, any of the following: Javascript frameworks (React/Angular/Node), MongoDB/NoSQL, SQL, Python
* Strong knowledge of data structures, algorithms and object oriented programming
* Strong communication skills, ability to work on a fast-paced team and collaborate with stakeholders and end users
* Knowledge of or interest in learning investment finance, portfolio theory and analytics (portfolio optimization, simulation or glidepath)
* 1-2+ years of relevant work experience
ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS

At Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869, we are a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York, we maintain offices around the world.

We believe who you are makes you better at what you do. We're committed to fostering and advancing diversity and inclusion in our own workplace and beyond by ensuring every individual within our firm has a number of opportunities to grow professionally and personally, from our training and development opportunities and firmwide networks to benefits, wellness and personal finance offerings and mindfulness programs. We’re thinking about coined trademarks in the car, a detailed design search over lunch, counterfeits while sitting with the in-laws, and anti-piracy while working out

We are a mission-led company, driven by a passion for making the world better and safer for our brand customers and their consumers. It’s what we do. And people come to Corsearch to be challenged, developed, supported, and valued
**The Role**
Technology at Corsearch currently consists of Engineering and Data Science functions, with nearly 200 people globally, aligned to Trademark Solutions or Online Brand Protection Business Units.

Trademark Solutions acquires data from 200 jurisdictions globally by means of data feeds, web crawling and publications/gazettes. The master data system ingests, enriches and stores data in order to support a complex ecosystem of platforms which underpin Corsearch’s managed search, screening & watch services.

The current master data system (“DMS”) is based on C#, MS SQL and MySQL. Corsearch is looking to recruit a new team to build out & transition to a replacement platform using managed services in the cloud.

The ideal candidate will have had prior experience with traditional database-driven software in .Net and Microsoft SQL and more recent experience with modern cloud Data Warehouse, Data Lake and ETL platforms.
We currently have roles available for:
* Junior
* Mid Level
* Senior
**Responsibilities and Duties**
* Assist in establishing the vision and **delivering a future** **master data, ingestion & analytics platform** for Trademark Solutions, based on scalable cloud technologies
* **Transition data flows** and dependencies from the legacy DMS to the new cloud data platform in order to enable DMS to be decomissioned
* **Integrate machine learning** into the data pipelines in order to enrich the data
* **Increase levels of automation**
* Establish **monitoring and measurement** of data quality & ingestion processes
* Ensure a **well-designed data model** where changes are managed and coordinated across the system
* Establish Continuous Integration, Delivery and Deployment pipelines, Infrastructure as code and Zero-downtime release processes
* Deliver quality code and create full documentation, including flowcharts, layouts, diagrams, charts, code comments and clear code, for all developed solutions
**Essential**
* Technical Skills
+ Cloud Data Lakes & Warehouses, such as Databricks, Redshift or Snowflake
+ SQL programming, including cloud/distributed SQL engines
+ Relational databases, such as SQL Server, MySQL or Oracle
+ Apache Spark, or similar
+ Cloud ETL such as dbt, Matillion, talend
+ Cloud Hosting with AWS
+ Python
+ Columnar data stores
+ ORM
+ Schema definitions, e.g. Avro
+ Non-relational databases such as Redis or MongoDB
+ Source Control and CI/CD systems, such as Git
* Engineering Practices, such as TDD and continuous integration
* Jira and Confluence
* Technical documentation, such as coding styles, branching strategies and functional specifications
* Automated enforcement of policies (e.g. linting, static analysis, stylecop)
* Agile development practices and continuous improvement
* Adopter of Open Source and awareness of intellectual property concerns
* Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Data Science or similar field
**Beneficial Skills & Experience:**
* Elasticsearch or Solr
* Familiarity with web crawling, OCR and PDF extraction
* Familiarity with Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing
* Data visualisation tools such as Looker, Tableau, or Power BI

With our AI-driven platform — the o9 Digital Brain — we integrate global enterprises’ siloed planning capabilities, helping them capture millions and, in some cases, billions of dollars in value leakage. But our impact doesn’t stop there. Businesses that plan better and faster also reduce waste, which drives better outcomes for the planet, too.

We're on the lookout for the brightest, most committed individuals to join us on our mission. Along the journey, we’ll provide you with a nurturing environment where you can be part of something truly extraordinary and make a real difference for companies and the planet.
About the role...

The ML Engineer plays a pivotal role in our organization, creating and maintaining advanced algorithmic libraries that our entire team relies on, including Data Scientists. Our ideal candidate is a highly experienced developer with a strong foundation in Data Science. As a ML Engineer, you will be responsible for developing algorithms that are robust, scalable, and maintainable. Algorithms that can handle immense volumes of data.
What you’ll do for us* Developing advanced models for time-series forecasting and anomaly detection specifically tailored for the CPG and Retail Industry.
* Ensure the scalability of our solutions and continuously optimize the performance of existing algorithms.
* Assure seamless integration of our libraries with the o9 Platform.
* Support Data Scientists using our algorithms.
* Keep us up-to-date with the latest academic research in the field.
Essential Qualifications & Skills
Experience:* 3+ years of experience in the field of Data Science and Machine Learning
* Experience with time series forecasting at scale in a retail environment is a big plus.
* Experience with open source contributions is a plus.
Education:* Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering or related field or
* Masters Degree in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Business Analytics, Operations, or related field
Skills:
Algorithms and Domain Knowledge:* Deep knowledge of fundamentals, and the state-of-the art, in relevant areas of ML, particularly time-series forecasting.
* Understanding of Supply Chain Concepts will be preferable
Language, Tools and Best Practices:* Strong Python programming skills and experience with at least one “lower level” language C/C++ or C#.
* Knowledge of professional software engineering practices and best practices for the full software development lifecycle, including coding standards, code reviews, and source control management.
* Knowledge of parallelizing frameworks such as Multiprocessing, Spark, Ray, etc and optimizing code for such frameworks is preferred.
* Experience working with Hadoop and Hive would be preferable.

Characteristics* Strong presentation and communications skills. You thrive in a fast paced, challenging environment, where there is much white space and problem solving is at the heart of what drives your analysis.
* We really value team spirit: Transparency and frequent communication is key. At o9, this is not limited by hierarchy, distance, or function
* Openness to learn from industry experts as well as willingness to mentor junior engineers.
What we’ll do for you* Competitive salary.
* Tech tools: Complementary Mac or PC laptop.
* Enjoy yourself: Unlimited paid time off.
* Get social: When we work from home, we play from home with fun after-work activities like Social Fridays. If you’re in the office, feel free to join these events in person.
* Flat organization: With a very strong entrepreneurial culture (and no corporate politics).
* Support network: Work with a team you can learn from and every day.
* Diversity: We pride ourselves on our international working environment.

Employee Testimonial*''What I like most about o9 is that I get to work with some of the smartest people in the industry. Every day is a new opportunity to learn and grow. At the same time everyone is friendly, helpful and fun to be around!''*
How the process works* Apply by clicking the apply button.

* You’ll be contacted by our recruiter, who’ll fill you in on all things o9, give you some background about the role and get to know you. They’ll contact you either via video call or phone call - whatever you prefer.
* During the interview phase, you will meet with the Hiring Manager for 45 minutes. The recruiter will contact you after the interview to let you know if we’d like to progress your application.
* Your application has progressed! Meet with a new panel for a final round of interviews for 30 minutes each.
* Our recruiter will let you know if you’re the successful candidate. Good luck!
More about us…

https://nl.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=5698bbff2efbb466,indeed,Senior Data Engineer,Appsbroker Ltd,https://nl.indeed.com/cmp/Appsbroker-Ltd,"Utrecht, UT, NL",fulltime,2024-07-02,,,,,True,,,,"As a Senior Data Engineer with Appsbroker CTS, you’ll design, build, and maintain scalable data pipelines and infrastructure that enable the efficient processing and analysis of large, complex data sets.
If you have an interest in working on innovative projects with cutting edge technology using Google Cloud Platform, this job could be a great opportunity for you.
### **Responsibilities:**
**Develop and maintain automated data processing pipelines using Google Cloud:**
* Design, build, and maintain data pipelines to support data ingestion, ETL, and storage
* Build and maintain automated data pipelines to monitor data quality and troubleshoot issues
**Implement and maintain databases and data storage solutions:**
* Stay up-to-date with emerging trends and technologies in big data and data engineering
* Ensure data quality, accuracy, and completeness
**Implement and enforce data governance policies and procedures to ensure data quality and accuracy:**
* Collaborate with data scientists and analysts to design and optimise data models for analytical and reporting purposes
* Develop and maintain data models to support analytics and reporting
* Monitor and maintain data infrastructure to ensure availability and performance
**Requirements**
### **Key Skills:**
* Experience with cloud platforms such as Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, or Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
* Strong proficiency in SQL and experience with relational databases such as MySQL, PostgreSQL, or Oracle.
* Experience with big data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, or Hive.
* Familiarity with data warehousing and ETL tools such as Amazon Redshift, Google BigQuery, or Apache Airflow.
* Proficiency in at least one programming language such as Python, Java, or Scala.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to work independently and in a team environment.
**Benefits**
* Competitive salary
* Private healthcare scheme
* Company pension
* Flexible working culture
* Market leading paid holiday entitlement
* Company events - opportunities to meet colleagues you don’t see every day
* Regular opportunities for industry recognised training and certifications
* Learning and development opportunities
* Opportunities to develop within a fast growing-tech business with ambitious growth and impact goals
### **Location:**

This role can be either fully remote or hybrid based depending on your preference. We have an office in Utrecht city centre, which you can choose to work from as often as you like. There is no mandatory office working, but you might be expected to travel to offices or customer sites for specific meetings or events.
### **Our Culture:**

CTS and Appsbroker have agreed a strategic merger, joining forces to become the largest Google Cloud-only digital consultancy in Europe. We’re looking for bright, passionate people to join us at the vanguard, delivering the most ambitious Google Cloud projects across AI, security, martech, data, and Workspace.

As part of our values, we believe in business with a positive impact, and we’re mindful of the way our company connects with the world around it. https://nl.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=7b75905f43f1c15f,indeed,Data Analyst/Scientist RaboResearch Food & Agribusiness,Rabobank,https://nl.indeed.com/cmp/Rabobank,"Utrecht, UT, NL",fulltime,2024-07-03,,,,,False,,,"Hosang.wu@rabobank.com, cindy.koolhout@rabobank.com, lex.verwayen@rabobank.nl","s Data Analyst/Scientist Food & Agribusiness at RaboResearch F&A you, together with more than 70 F&A colleagues globally, generate data-driven insights, (proprietary) data sets, and models, which are used for our research, publication client meetings, and the bank itself.
**You and your job**

As a Data Analyst/Scientist Food & Agribusiness, you’ll work together with other F&A data analysts/scientists and more than 70 Global F&A Analysts from different regions (e.g. Australia New Zealand, North America, South America, and Asia) and Europe and sectors (e.g. Animal Protein, Dairy, Fresh Produce, Consumer Foods, Grain & Oilseeds) and related themes (e.g. Climate, Nature), the bank’s highly valued F&A knowledge centre. The models/data and insights generated are crucial for the bank and clients to maintain and develop their businesses (strategy).
**PracticalExamples**
* Develop, maintain, and help improve unique data sets, models, and tools to support stakeholders and clients.
* As a team player you collaborate with F&A experts and stakeholders to turn their knowledge and needs into data models, tools, and insights
* Proactively participate in modelling and data analytical initiatives
* Proactively contribute to F&A research projects and publications together with F&A analysts
* Our insights are presented to our wholesale and rural clients' prospects and press, and most are published via Rabobank Knowledge Hub.
**Facts & Figures**
* 36 hours per week
* Work together with 180 analysts (researchers and data analyst and scientists) of which 70 in Food & Agribusiness
* Part of an international and diverse F&A research & data team in Europe and Africa
* 43,822 Rabobank colleagues around the world
**Top responsibilities**

* Work closely together with F&A analysts and fulfil research needs with efficient or innovative solutions. Think along and challenge domain experts in the creation of unique research using your technical knowledge.
* Clearly define the objectives and timelines of your projects and the steps to take. Share the progress and project results with your main stakeholders regularly.
**Together we achieve more than alone**

We believe in the power of difference. Bringing together people's differences is what makes us an even better bank. So we are very curious about what you can bring to our Global RaboResearch F&A team:

Hosang: *“Being part of RaboResearch allows you to work on major topics that impact the food value chain and (in)directly society and the world as a whole. You will have a great time here if you enjoy connecting with stakeholders and providing hands-on solutions that bring new insights to the table.”*

Together with the other three F&A data analysts/scientists you are part of the RaboResearch F&A Europe and Africa team (In total 20 FTE) and one of our data analysts is located in our North America team. All 5 Data experts (including you) work closely together with the F&A analysts, providing our clients with the newest sector insights, creating ‘order from chaos’. You will focus on the support of one or more Global F&A sector teams. RaboResearch has a Global Matrix structure in place (regions vs. sectors).
Working together is the way we work
column2: as 1 results-driven, analytical, and pragmatic team at Rabobank. Talking of Rabobank: We are a Dutch bank that operates in 38 countries for over 9,500,000 customers. Together with these customers, our members, and partners we stand side by side to create a world in which everyone has access to enough healthy food and green energy. In the Netherlands we work to create a country in which people are happy with how they live, work and do business.

column1: **You and your talent**

Ideally, we are looking for an Agricultural or Applied Economist with Data skills – in practical terms, you've built maintainable analytical models in Python that have been used to look at topics at any stage along the value chain from production-based ag to the consumer foods sector (farm to fork). Projects will include working on sector based models to cultivating proprietary data and tools (e.g. dashboards).

The team practice is a hybrid between agile and consulting – a person who thrives will take complex problems, break them into parts, and deliver the highest value-added first. Evaluation will be based on an interview, a code sample, and a technical presentation.
* A solid foundation of statistics, preferably agricultural econometrics, and modelling. (for example MSc in business information management, agricultural or applied economy, econometry)
* An enthusiastic team player, who is willing to embrace and share knowledge and expertise
* Initiates improvements and contributes to their realization and can set up data research autonomously following the research question
* Strong interpersonal skills to build and maintain relationships within and outside RaboResearch and to communicate research results effectively to clients and (internal) stakeholders

* Involved in identifying and advising on complex insights, modelling experience (foundational/intermediate level )in real-life business settings with traditional (structural/econometrics) and algorithmic (statistical/Bayesian) approaches
* Experience in Azure-based environments, strong hands-on programming skills (Python) and experience in setting up data pipelines
* Fluent in English, both verbally and in writing. Proficiency in Dutch is considered an advantage
**This is what we offer you**
* Basic salary from € 3,711 up to € 6.168 gross per month (scale 8 or 9, depending on your experience)

* On top: thirteenth month's salary, 8% holiday allowance and an extra budget of 10% (scale 8) or 11% (scale 9) of your gross salary to be used at your discretion. Buy extra holiday hours, add more to your pension savings or ask for part of the extra budget to be paid out.
* a combination of working from home (3 days) and at the office (2 days)
This is a selection of the terms of employment for Data Analyst/Scientist based on a 36-hour working week. You can find all terms of employment on rabobank.jobs/en/conditions-of-employment.
**You and the job application process**

* Any questions about the job content? Contact: Hosang Wu, Data Scientist, via Hosang.wu@rabobank.com, or Cindy Koolhout, Head RaboResearch F&A Europe & Africa, via cindy.koolhout@rabobank.com or +31620604124
* Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Please contact Lex Verwayen, Corporate Recruiter, via lex.verwayen@rabobank.nl

* An assignment will be part of the process. With the assignment we want to test your modeling and coding skills as well as your capability to explain a complex question and solution to colleagues with no data science skills.
* You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on rabobank.jobs/en/faq
* A security check is part of the process
* We respect your privacy

https://nl.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=a6eccd804a8df7e9,indeed,Machine Learning Engineer Future Model Landscape,DLL Group,https://nl.indeed.com/cmp/Dll-Group,"Eindhoven, NB, NL",,2024-07-03,,,,,True,,,natascha.hooi@dllgroup.com,"**Machine Learning Engineer Future Model Landscape**

What if your expertise as a Machine Learning Engineer Future Model Landscape would help build the data foundation needed to create state of the art predictive models supporting our business and customers every single day? What if your knowledge, skills, and enthusiasm would contribute directly to the success of a global company?
You bridge the gap between business, data and technology. You identify the needs for data of the data scientists and translate them into the right data products.

You will be working in an international team of professionals that have a true passion for what they do. DLL is an IRB financial institution with a unique combination of great opportunities, short reporting lines and broad responsibilities. Data is essential to everything we do, and we rely on dedicated teams of specialists, from data collection to modelling, validation to model implementation. Collaboration is the tool we use to achieve our goals and ambitions. Together, through diversity and inclusion, we will become better at what we do.
Find out more here about how you can unleash your full potential at DLL
**Day to day:**
* As a Machine Learning Engineer Future Model Landscape, you are responsible for the availability and quality of the data for our Risk- and Non-Regulatory Models.
* Together with the team of modelers you decide what data is necessary to successfully develop a model.
* You will investigate if the requested data is already available on the Azure Data Platform.
* If not, you will work closely together with departments in different countries to collect and test the data.
* You will also work closely together with IT to automate the onboarding of the data on the Azure data platform from different applications.
* Next step is to test the quality of the data. If necessary, you will initiate actions together with IT and the application owners to improve the data quality.
* If the necessary data is available and of good quality, you are responsible to transform the data into an integrated model dataset and make it available to the modelers.
* This is an iterative process until the model meets the required performance.
* Together with the team, you are responsible for the data on the data platform and help ensure that there is proper governance around changes in the model data landscape.
* You will also support documentation of data collection and testing activities as well as validation of these activities by the Model Validation team where needed.
* You will provide guidance and support to less experienced team members in the above areas.
* You will, in the above activities, interact with stakeholders from many different teams/departments, such as Predictive Modeling, Data Management, (local) Finance, Sales, and IT.
* You will report to the manager Data Analytics.
**All members enjoy**
* Two working days per year volunteering for a local charity
* Health and Wellness program including healthy food, free health checks, fun health & vitality activities
* Flexible hours with possibility to work from home
* Career development opportunities: online learning, member development programs
* Click this link for an overview of all the benefits in your region.
“We lead the way in meeting the need for flexibility and transparency which our customers increasingly expect”
**Essentials:**
* A Bachelor or Master’s degree in a data- or IT-related field
* 5 - 10 years of professional experience working in a similar role
* Understanding data is a true passion of yours
* Strong written and verbal communication skills
* Proven experience in executing quantitative analyses using SQL and R/Python, and ability to work with MS Excel
* You have a good eye for detail and strong interpersonal skills
* Demonstrated affinity with the development of predictive models
* You are a self-starter and able to work in an organization with a complex system and data landscape
* Strong analytical and project management skills.
**Extras:**
* Knowledge and experience with the application of Agile and Scrum practices
* Experience in working with Microsoft Azure technology and Databricks
* Prior experience working in the Finance industry / credit risk domain and knowledge of relevant regulation
* Preference to work in a dynamic, international environment.
**Choose wellbeing**

DLL’s wellbeing ambition is to educate, equip and empower members to build connections, manage their mental, emotional, physical and financial wellness and maintain balance between work and the other priorities that make up their lives.
Our four wellbeing categories are as follows:
* Connection – Build meaningful connections with other DLL members
* Health – Manage mental, emotional and physical health
* Finance – Provide learning opportunities to help members achieve personal financial health
* Lifestyle – Maintain balance between work and life priorities
These are the things that matter to our members and the wellbeing of our members matters to DLL
**Settling in**

At DLL, we are many things. We are team members, family members, community member. We are members of society, members of different cultures and nationalities. Members of change. We each have different beliefs, different passions, different viewpoints, talents and interests. We come from different backgrounds, cultures, nationalities and histories.
But for all of our differences, we share one thing in common: each of us are members of DLL.

Our company was founded in the Netherlands. But today we are truly a multinational business. Our unique culture is rooted in higher collaboration, less hierarchy and an honest directness that enable us to integrate, ideate and innovate across country lines.
Many companies say they are European, American, Asian or Australian, at DLL we are all these places and more.
We are a cross-culture collaborative – an interconnected network – that comes together every single day with one goal in mind: **Partnering for a better world.**
**Good to know:**
* Deadline for application: July 21st (Due to high volume of applications this requisition may close prior to posted close date)
* The selection process may involve an assessment
* Applications via email will not be reviewed. Please apply online via our career website
* DLL’s referral program applies
* #LI-NA1
* For more information, please contact our Talent acquisition partner Natascha Hooi via natascha.hooi@dllgroup.com.
DLL appreciates the time you spend applying to our openings. We advise only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted. Hiring subject to successful completion of a background check.

DLL is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes and work environments. If contacted for an employment opportunity, please advise Human Resources if you require accommodation in accordance with our values and all applicable legislation.

https://nl.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=2977b956837fdf43,indeed,Medior Data Engineer,northpool,https://nl.indeed.com/cmp/Northpool,"Leiden, ZH, NL",,2024-07-02,,,,,False,,,,"**GRASP THE OPPORTUNITY**

Northpool has four trading desks: an intraday desk, short term, long term and algorithmic trading. All these trading desks need their crucial data to make the best trading decisions, each trading desk has its own requirements that must be taken into account. Our trading desks are supported by the Operations, Data & Analytics department, which also includes our Data Engineers.

All dashboards, models and databases are built internally by us. Our team of Data Engineers collects the data and ensures that it is processed correctly so that the Data Scientists and Analysts can use it to build models and tools.

As a Medior Data Engineer, in addition to programming, you will be responsible for coaching/supervising the Junior Data Engineers and transferring knowledge within the organization. You will be asked to think along about new developments that are needed and how we can further optimize the various data flows.
Your challenge?

Ensuring that the data flows are set up as optimally as possible, monitoring the quality of the data and creating the conditions for the team of Data Engineers to be self-reliant. Ensure that the team, despite everyone’s personal working methods, has the same standards and speaks the same ‘language’. Thinking along with seniors and leads from various departments to improve design in data architecture.
For this position, we are looking for a Medior Data Engineer to support the short-term and day-ahead trading desk. You will be part of the agile team that develops solutions that support trading.
**WE ASK:**
* A MSc degree in Computer Science
* At least 2 years of relevant work experience
* At least 2 years of experience with Python and 2 years of experience with SQL
* Knowledge of data warehousing architectures
* Experience with building data pipelines
* Capability of translating business logic to technical solutions
* Good social and communication skills
* A strong sense of responsibility and a willingness to take ownership of your work.
**WE LIKE:**
* Experience with Docker
* Interest or experience in working with realtime data streaming
* Interest in back-end programming
* Pro-active and flexible work mentality
* Interest in Trading
* Experience in working with Snowflake and/or Kafka
* Experience with Microsoft Azure
**WE OFFER:**
* Training, continuous learning and development opportunities
* Annual performance-based bonus
* A non-hierarchical workplace
* Young and highly motivated teammates
* Ownership in your work
* A fun, international workplace
* Plenty of social events!
Location: for this vacancy we need you to live in The Netherlands. Also, the application procedure will take place at our office in Leiden.
To enhance collaboration in a dynamic trading environment you will partly be working at the trading desk, close to our traders. Therefore, you would be working in the office 4 days a week.
Acquisition based on this vacancy is not appreciated.",data scientist,https://www.northpool.nl/vacancies/medior-data-engineer,,,,,,,,,,,2977b956837fdf43,,en,,,

Characteristics* Strong presentation and communications skills. You thrive in a fast paced, challenging environment, where there is much white space and problem solving is at the heart of what drives your analysis.

https://nl.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=a0aa773cefdb9f9d,indeed,Senior BI Specialist,Exact,https://nl.indeed.com/cmp/Exact-9,"Delft, ZH, NL",,2024-07-02,,,,,True,,,,"(Sr.) Professional Job Netherlands, Delft Corporate Functions Netherlands

As a Senior BI Specialist, you participate and provide input for data integration, transformation of multiple data source systems, develop data warehouses with a combination of business intelligence, data visualization and reporting tools. Next to this, you advocate self-service analytics and will give training sessions to empower the business to build their own reports, dash boards and power BI models. At Exact, your technical skills and “dare to” mentality, can lead to the best innovations. And where is your career heading? That’s up to you. The career opportunities are unprecedented. 2000 enterprising colleagues have already paved the way. Are you on board?
**This = the job you are looking for:**
* Provide expert guidance on Business Intelligence (BI) skills and technologies.
* Develop scalable and maintainable BI applications to meet business objectives.
* Develop security and authentication standards for the department.
* Maintain accurate and complete technical architectural documents.
* Define BI standards, guidelines and best practices for business groups and technical teams.
* Support BI tools upgrades in development, testing and documentation.
* Perform maintenance and troubleshooting activities for BI tools.
* Diagnose and resolve BI tool capacity issues.
* Recommend strategies to improve performance and capacity of BI tools.
* Address customer queries and issues in a timely manner.
* Provide technical training on BI tools to team members.
* Collaborate with BI Administrators, Developers and Analysts for successful development of BI reporting and analysis solutions.
* Work with business groups and technical teams to develop and maintain data warehouse platform for BI reporting.
* Design and build tabular models writing complex DAX formulae.
* Build scalable data warehouse solutions using PaaS and SaaS services in Microsoft cloud.
* Address master data issues and provide data solutions to manage them.

You will join the 6 colleagues in the Corporate BI department. They are known for their great technical knowledge and smooth cooperation. Asking for help if necessary and offering help if possible is part of their DNA. We have few predefined paths, which gives you plenty of room to choose your own.
**The main responsibilities of the department are:**

* Key operations of the business intelligence team begin with the design and deployment of the BI architecture, which includes source systems, data warehouses, and a combination of business intelligence, data visualization, and reporting tools.
* Advocate self-service analytics and train to empower Business to build their own reports, dash boards and power BI models.
* Agree to SLA’s for providing front line support to the business users on the BI cubes and deliver big fixes and enhancements on a timely basis.
**This = what you bring**

With us, you can be yourself, and we would love to discover what sets you apart. For the position of Senior BI Specialist, it’s helpful if you have analytical skills and that you have good communications skills. What’s more, you bring:
* Microsoft suite of BI tools (Both On-premises and Cloud)
* Relevant experience in building data warehouse solutions in cloud using PaaS and SaaS services.
* Around 10 or more years of experience
* Reporting tools, mainly Power BI
* Data modeling, data warehousing, data visualization & analytics
* Programming languages like Python, .net, R would be added value.
**This = what you get**

At Exact we value the balance between work and relaxation. You can work up a sweat in our own gym or take a break at the coffee bar. Empty your head and then tackle your daily tasks with renewed energy. And, of course, that's not all. As a Senior BI Specialist, based on 40 hours per week, you can also count on:
* A competitive salary package incl. a 13th month and of course 8% holiday allowance
* An international, innovative and hybrid working environment, with the flexibility to work from home or any of our offices
* Over 2000 colleagues worldwide of which more than 500 in technology.
* 27 vacation days and in addition, loyalty days
column2: one for each year in service with a max of 5

column1: * 3 Giving back days, which can spend on giving back to (local) community
* A modern pension scheme
* All the room your ambition needs and to further develop your skills we facilitate training via our learning and development center to help you to fulfill your career potential
* Friday afternoon drinks at our bar “Bits & Bytes”
**About Exact**

Exact develops cloud software for small and medium-sized companies and their accountants. The products automate business processes in areas such as Finance and HR and provide specific ERP solutions for wholesale distribution, manufacturing, projects and construction. This saves time and provides insight. It enables customers to work efficiently, make informed decisions and continue growing. More than 675,000 companies primarily in the Netherlands, Belgium and Germany already rely on Exact's software.

Exact was founded in 1984 in Delft, the Netherlands, which is still the location of our head office. Every day, more than 2,000 ambitious professionals work on innovation. Driving responsible business, with respect for each other, the environment and society is central to this. For more information, visit www.exact.com.
Contact Arthur Fransen

https://nl.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=b8cbd5df984085d1,indeed,Data Specialist,Rabobank,https://nl.indeed.com/cmp/Rabobank,"Utrecht, UT, NL",fulltime,2024-07-02,,,,,False,,,"alet.nel@rabobank.nl, lex.verwayen@rabobank.nl","**Data Specialist**

Your expertise truly drives the solutions that sustain our business and the products that serve our customers. Our Data Specialists have to stand out from the rest. We need Data professionals who constantly drive the focus on managed data solutions.
**You and your Job**

As a Data Specialist within the Customer Insights team, you will play a crucial role in analysing and interpreting data to provide valuable insights for our business. You will be using your analytical expertise to translate data into powerful models and actionable insights with the aim to better understand our customers and improve our products and services. You are a strong communicator able to advise product, development and sales teams with your data driven stories. If you have a relevant bachelor’s degree (preferably a master’s degree), strong analytical abilities, and a passion for programming and data analysis, we encourage you to apply.
**Practical Examples**
* Investigate business information needs and define functionalities for new tools and models.
* Develop and maintain analytics solutions for data processing and visualization.
* Create models and algorithms that continuously recognize, signal, and report patterns in data.
* Independently collect, edit, validate, and understand collected data for predictive insights.
* Contribute to process improvements and operational design.
* Act as a sparring partner, providing expertise and advice to colleagues and management.
**Facts & Figures**
* 36 hours per week
* Part of Business Banking with colleagues from a wide range of backgrounds and countries
* 43,822 Rabobank colleagues around the world
**Top 6 Responsibilities**
* Understanding Business Needs: Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand their information requirements and formulate specific questions that drive data analysis.
* Make Business Impact: Make suggestions for business/process improvements based on the findings/insights from the analysis and data.
* Data Transformation and Insights: Develop user-friendly solutions that transform large datasets into actionable insights based on predefined specifications.
* Data Collection and Validation: Gather, process, validate, and analyze data to extract predictive insights.
* Effective Communication: Advise decision-makers and ensure satisfaction among internal and external stakeholders.
* Monitoring and Coordination: Efficiently monitor, coordinate, and adjust activities to achieve desired results aligned with organizational goals.
**Together we achieve more then alone**

We believe in the power of difference. Bringing together people's differences is what makes us an even better bank. So we are very curious about what you can bring to our team at Commercial Products and Services.

‘Being part of the bigger Business Banking team creates a lot of opportunity to collaborate with colleagues which creates excitement in our B2B Sales team and also brings us together as part of the Commercial Products and Services team.’
Alet Nel, Customer Insights Specialist

Customer Insights is part of Customer Engagement within B2B Sales that is part of Commercial Products and Services within Business Banking that is part of Retail Netherlands. Our main focus areas are the improvement of customer satisfaction and journeys
column2: existing customer management
column3: and identifying additional revenue opportunities. Working together is the way we work
column4: as 1 team at Rabobank. Talking of Rabobank: We are a Dutch bank that operates in 38 countries for over 9,5000,000 customers. Together with these customers, our members and partners we stand side by side to create a world in which everyone has access to enough healthy food. In the Netherlands we work to create a country in which people are happy with how they live, work and do business.

column1: **You and your talent**

The work you do will impact your team and your internal and external stakeholders, but also the client servicing process and therefore the bank’s core business. This impacts the way Rabobank actively serves its clients.
In addition to that, you:
* Hold a Bachelor’s degree (preferably master’s) in a relevant field.
* Strong analytical skills.
* Affinity for programming, data, and analysis (e.g., SQL, Python)
* Experience with visualization tools (e.g., PowerBI).
* Excellent presentation skills.
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively.
* Proficiency in both English and Dutch.
If you meet these qualifications and are passionate about data, we encourage you to apply. Join our dynamic team and make a meaningful impact!
**This is what we offer yo**
* Gross salary between € 3.711 and € 5.300 per month (scale 8). Depending on your experience and seniority.
* A thirteenth month and holiday pay

* An Employee Benefit Budget, 10 % of your monthly salary. You decide how to spend this budget. This may include purchasing extra leave days, making extra pension contributions or even receiving a monthly cash payout
* A compensation for your commute if you travel by public transport, bicycle or car
* A pension scheme, to which you have the choice to contribute 3.5% or 5.5%
* Hybrid working
* A personal development budget of €1400.
**You and the job application process**
Are you ready to join Rabobank as a Data Specialist and to make a difference to yourself, our customers and to society? We look forward to receiving your application for this vacancy in Utrecht.
* Any questions about the job content? Contact: Alet Nel, Customer Insights Specialist via alet.nel@rabobank.nl.
* Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Lex Verwayen, Corporate Recruiter via lex.verwayen@rabobank.nl.
* Your privacy is important to us. If you would like to find out more about this, please click on this link.
* A security check is part of the process.
* You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on rabobank.jobs/en/faq.
* Everyone is different, and it is exactly those differences that help us become an even better bank. That's why we want to know who you really are!

https://nl.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=fe223a2f6fa91019,indeed,Machine Learning Engineer,Beyond Sports,https://nl.indeed.com/cmp/Beyond-Sports-1,"Alkmaar, NH, NL",fulltime,2024-07-02,,,,,False,,,,"Beyond Sports is an AI-based visualization company that offers a new way of experiencing sports. We push the boundaries of sports content creation together with industry giants like NHL, NFL, FIFA, Disney, and many more.
**Job Description**

Our Machine Learning team is looking to expand in the direction of motion synthesis and 3D graphics. We are searching for a candidate who is passionate about applying cutting-edge technologies to data-driven virtual environments. We offer a vibrant office and a diverse team to collaborate on a variety of projects.

As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will contribute to the development of tools that enhance the creative workflow of our artists and systems that make our virtual characters follow the live tracking data of a sports match. Part of your work will include the development of generative models, ML-based data augmentation and the validation of limb tracking systems. After prototyping, the models are deployed as cloud-hosted APIs. While the models are developed in Python, you will sometimes use Unity to collect data or validate the output.
**Responsibilities**
* Implement and maintain robust systems to facilitate the automated analysis of sports data, ensuring accuracy and efficiency.
* Research and prototype advanced ML models for trajectory prediction, motion synthesis, and 2D to 3D geometry pipelines (e.g., Transformers, GNNs, Diffusion).
* Develop and deploy your machine learning models as cloud-hosted APIs to enable seamless integration and accessibility across the organization.
* Collaborate with team members to keep our codebases clean, scalable, and maintainable.
* Stay up to date on the latest research and identify opportunities for new systems at Beyond Sports.
* Review your teammates code and give constructive feedback.
**Qualifications**
* MSc degree in Computer Science, Computer Graphics, Artificial Intelligence, or equivalent.
* 1-3 years of professional experience in the field of Machine Learning or Data Science.
* Experience with developing state-of-the-art models in Tensorflow or PyTorch.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English.
* Able to collaborate with people from different backgrounds, like artists and game programmers.
* Able to work in our inspiring office in Alkmaar.
**Nice to have**
* Affinity with mathematical modelling and algorithm development.
* Experience with deploying models in a cloud computing platform, such as AWS or Azure.
* Proficiency with Git and MLOps tools, like MLFlow, for version control and experiment tracking.
* Experience with Unity or another game engine.
* Basic knowledge about football and team sports in general.
**Benefits**
Be part of a productive and dynamic work environment
Personal development planning
Work closely with innovative companies like Sony and Hawk-Eye
25 holidays per annum
Healthy prepared lunch and fresh fruits every day
Company gym card

This role, reporting to the global co-heads of private equity, is integral to advancing our digitalization vision.**

Master / WO

2 juli 2024
### **Dit wordt je functie**
**Functieomschrijving**
**Job description:**

As a Quant Developer, you will play a pivotal role in shaping and executing our data & analytics strategy, leveraging and optimizing our existing data architecture. Key responsibilities include streamlining data ingestion, integrating relevant (big) data sources, collaborating with the business on decision-making, analyzing complex datasets, developing machine learning models, and providing actionable insights to drive strategic business decisions.
This position is ideal for candidates with a strong quantitative background, offering an exciting opportunity to contribute to our business growth.
**Dit ga je doen**
**Main Duties and Responsibilities:**
* Contribute to the development of the digitalization vision within Private Equity.
* Enhance data pipelines, visualizations (graphs), and analytical tools for increased professionalism.
* Conduct thematic research with a quantitative focus on pertinent topics to evaluate the impact on the investment portfolio.
* Transform research findings into robust analytics with minimal maintenance requirements.
**Dit breng je mee**
**Job Requirements:**
* Master’s degree or higher with high distinction in quantitative methods, mathematics, or a related statistical/data-oriented field from a top-tier school.
* Relevant experience as a quant developer or quantitative analyst.
* Proficiency in programming languages, particularly Python.
* Experience with SQL and data manipulation libraries (e.g., Pandas, NumPy).
* Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Dash).
* Strong problem-solving and communication skills.
* Long-term value creation mindset: broad-minded, innovative, forward-thinking.
* Ability to collaborate effectively with internal and external stakeholders.
* Adaptability and willingness to address a diverse range of demands.
* Profound knowledge of English language.
* Willing to undertake occasional regional travel.
**Dit bieden wij**
**What APG has to offer**
We offer you a competitive monthly salary based on 40-hours and attractive terms of employment with a
focus on flexibility.
* A guaranteed year-end bonus of 8.33%
* A target driven bonus scheme
* Ample attention to your vitality and personal development
* Ability to grow your professional network, internally as well as externally
* Working from home for 2 to 3 days, and also working from one of our beautiful offices
* And of course a well-organized pension.
For pension provider APG, pensions are about people, life and how we live together. Through careful asset
management, pension administration, communication and advice, APG wants to help building a decent
future in which we share our well-being and prosperity honestly and sustainably. For present and future
generations. For today, tomorrow and beyond.
APG is committed to serving 4.7 million people in the Netherlands. That explains the importance we attach
to reflecting Dutch society. To that end, APG strives for an inclusive work environment in which everyone
can be themselves and their unique qualities are embraced.
Choosing APG means choosing a job in which you contribute to a bright future. Don’t delay, apply today! **Meer informatie**
**More information**

For more information please feel free to reach out to Carlos Garcia Rivas. You can contact him via the following e-mail address: carlos.garciarivas@apg-am.nl. If you have any other question, please contact our recruiter Roy Tholen, roy.tholen@apg.nl.
A Pre-Employment Screening is part of the procedure.
