https://nl.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=3e26ec2e0ce60689,indeed,Business Analyst,MAERSK,https://nl.indeed.com/cmp/Maersk,"Den Haag, ZH, NL",fulltime,2024-07-22,,,,,False,,,accommodationrequests@maersk.com,"The Business Analyst is part of the Strategy & Transformation Office (STO), reporting into the Transformation Lead for the Business Intelligence and Benchmarking program. As a Business Analyst, you will be responsible for bridging the gap between business needs and data-driven solutions.
**Business Analyst**
**Company**

A.P. Moller-Maersk (Maersk) is a worldwide transport and logistics company with offices in around 130 countries and with global headquarters in Copenhagen, Denmark. Maersk is listed on the Copenhagen Stock Exchange. Maersk employs roughly 95,000 people and generated total revenue of 51 billion USD in 2023. Maersk is currently undergoing a complex transformation from having been a relatively diversified conglomerate to becoming a focused transport and logistics company.

APM Terminals (APMT), a maritime terminal operator and core business unit of Maersk, operates one of the world’s most comprehensive port networks, which is uniquely positioned to help both shipping line- and landside customers grow their business and achieve better supply chain efficiency, flexibility and dependability to compete and win in world markets. The APMT team of 23,000 industry professionals across 42 countries and spanning five continents, is focused on providing customers with the most advanced terminal technology, equipment and operations in the industry across a network of +75 ports. In 2023, APM Terminals generated revenues 3.8 billion USD and carried out 40 million TEUs.

APMT is, like Maersk, undergoing an all-encompassing transformation from a multi-local, loosely coupled portfolio of individual terminals towards an integrated, best-in-class global terminal operator and stevedore. We casually refer to the journey as ‘ *from freestyle to franchise’* . The transformation involves developing and rolling out APMT’s *Way of Working* , built around a common operating system founded on Lean principles. It also entails a fundamental overhaul of our (digital) enterprise architecture to enable data-fueled business decisions, and cross-pollination of standard processes across our operations, including automation. Finally, the transformation aims to embed a culture of joint problem solving, (local) entrepreneurship and a collaborative mindset across our organization, including strong(er) linkages between our HQ- and frontline teams.
**Business Analyst in the Business Intelligence & Benchmarking program**

The Business Analyst is part of the Strategy & Transformation Office (STO), reporting into the Transformation Lead for the Business Intelligence and Benchmarking program. As a Business Analyst, you will be responsible for bridging the gap between business needs and data-driven solutions. Your role is to be a partner to the business, in which you will collaborate with business stakeholders to understand what drives value and assess indicators and data models for this. You will need to create an understanding of operational or business processes, develop models to represent this, and analyse data to create actionable insights. You will also work together closely with our data delivery teams to co-create what our data products need to look like, translated from business and technical requirements you help create. Lastly, together with the team, you will need to work together to contribute to the broader roadmap of data-driven value identification across the business, contributing to the project plans and initiatives to achieve this.

This position requires a mix of strong analytical & logical thinking, business acumen, problem solving, data analysis skills and project management, as well as stakeholder management, soft skills and the ability to frame up, execute, and drive resolution to complex issues. This is a dynamic, fast paced role that involves simultaneously seeing the bigger picture along with the small pieces that are critical to success.
**We are looking for**
* A passion for working with business stakeholders in identifying value and improvement initiatives
* A strong analytical mind that can navigate complexity in operations and business, can distil priority areas, and can simplify this into a problem statement and (data-driven) solution plan
* Someone that utilizes data-savviness to think through use-cases and ensure that data solutions align with business and operational needs

* Someone with strong data analysis and modelling skills that can easily extract key insights and is able to spot key patterns in information. Proficiency in data analysis tools & techniques (Excel & SQL, data-querying or similar, advanced techniques are a plus)

* Someone that can present and visualize these insights in a logical and comprehensible way that helps drive actionable insights and supports business decisions. Proficiency in presentation, visualization and insights tools & techniques (Powerpoint & PowerBI or similar)
* Flexibility with the ability to manage multiple topics and projects simultaneously and take ownership and responsibility of projects, with the tenacity to see them through
* A collaborative team player that is hands-on with a can-do attitude and proactive
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills (both verbal and written). Possess empathy, personal tact, and multi-cultural understanding
* Strong project management skills, with experience in creating and managing project plans
* Familiarity with agile way-of-working and defining technical and business requirements

* A minimum of 4+ years work experience in a similar capacity, experience in generating or working with data-driven insights, and working with business and operational processes definition and analysis
* Consulting experience is a plus
* Experience with the logistics, transportation, or mining industry is a plus – experience in working with large complex (blue chip) companies is a must
* English fluency written and spoken, and international work experience is beneficial
* Based in the Netherlands, but willingness to travel
* Master’s degree in e.g., Math, Physics, Engineering, Econometrics, Finance, Business Administration, or similar

*Research shows that while male candidates feel confident enough to apply when they meet about 60% of the requirements, female candidates only apply when they tick every box. So if this role has your name on it, but you’re not sure about the criteria, we still want to hear from you.*

https://nl.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=2293906aa685ce57,indeed,"Software engineer, Laser micromachining / CAM",Lightmotif,https://nl.indeed.com/cmp/Lightmotif,"Enschede, OV, NL",,2024-07-22,,,,,False,,,martijn.sipkema@lightmotif.nl,"Lightmotif, Enschede
Job description
As a software engineer you are working on improving our machine control and CAM software. You are part of
a small product development team that’s responsible for the development of advanced laser micromachining
systems.
You will design, implement, and test new functionality for our systems. You will work on custom machining
systems, participate in collaborative research projects, and work with our laser process engineers and
industrial end-users on the development of new laser micromachining applications.
Lightmotif is a small company. That means your job will be diverse, as you will be working on multiple projects
at a time, with different technical challenges. It also means you have the opportunity to really make a
difference—you will have a significant impact on the direction of our software development.
Responsibilities • Design, implement, test, and maintain / improve software.
* Work in R&D projects on new system capabilities and develop new applications together with our
laser process engineers.
* Assist customers with custom applications, training, or troubleshooting.
Qualifications
Minimum qualifications
* BS degree in computer science, similar technical field of study or equivalent experience.
* Software development experience in one or more general purpose programming languages.
* Ability to speak and write Dutch as well as English fluently in a professional working environment.
Preferred qualifications
* Further education or experience in engineering, computer science, or other technical related field.
* Advanced level C, C++, or Python programming skills.
* Experience in one or more of the following fields: visualization / computer graphics, motion control /
robotics, web application development, CAD/CAM, industrial automation, data acquisition and
control, programmable logic controllers, networking, embedded systems.
* Experience with programming and/or system administration in a UNIX environment.
* Strong people and communication skills.
Company profile
Lightmotif is an innovative supplier of ultrashort pulse laser micromachining systems and processes. We
support customers from first idea to production in diverse markets like automotive, consumer products or
medical devices. We develop and sell high-end machines, support customers in process and application
development, and offer job-shop services for small scale production.
Contact
Martijn Sipkema
**Email:** martijn.sipkema@lightmotif.nl
**Website:** www.lightmotif.nl

Planning Transformation Program Manager
Job Description
Planning Transformation Program Manager:
Implement an advanced planning system to drive excellence and to shape the future of planning. Manage transformative change of our planning processes and systems.

Your role:* Drive the evolution of our digital planning capabilities to achieve excellence in serving our customers and enabling business success for complex, long lead-time, make-to-order value chains including installations.

* Lead and program manage the successful delivery of projects within scope, time, and budget, ensure alignment of project goals with strategy and objectives, and drive continuous improvement in project management practices and methodologies.

* Ensure the program is set up for success, including scope management, requirements, schedule, dependency management, budget, quality, resources, and manage risks. Develop detailed project plans, define project scope, and manage all phases of the project lifecycle. Monitor and manage program progress through implementation aof actionable leading and lagging KPIs with a focus on business impact.

* Deploy and enforce project governance frameworks to ensure compliance with organizational standards and best practices. Develop impactful presentations for different stakeholder groups, including but not limited to senior stakeholders for the Executive and Operational Steering Committee.

* Ensure Planning Transformation goals, objectives, roadmaps, and expected outcomes are clearly defined and aligned with all relevant business, region and ISC stakeholders, including but not limited to senior leadership. Establish strong partnership with the respective partners from IT and digital teams.

* Engage with key stakeholders to ensure project alignment and address any issues or changes promptly. Build strong partnerships with program stakeholders across all layers (both internal and external) and leverage them to achieve organizational goals.

You're the right fit if:* You have at least 8 years of experience in Supply Chain Planning, Supply Chain Management, Project Management, or equivalent in complex, long lead-time, make-to-order value chains, including installations.

* You have a proven track record with at least 5 years in program management and transformation leadership, particularly related to designing and implementing sustainable transformation projects, leveraging digitization and automation.

* You have excellent experience in managing difficult stakeholders across different domains incl. senior leadership, and the ability to present ideas to leaders and teams clearly and concisely, creating compelling narratives and impactful presentations.
* Excellent understanding of and hands-on experience with advanced planning digital systems.
* You have strong experience in coordinating multiple related projects across domains to achieve strategic objectives, overseeing interdependencies and aligning them with organizational goals.
* You have sound knowledge of financial principles, including budgeting, forecasting, financial analysis, and cost management.

* Strong analytical skills to drive data-driven decisions and develop strategies. You excel in problem-solving, being able to create a clear problem statement and analyze complex issues in a structured way. Proficiency in data analysis and visualization tools (e.g., Excel, PowerPoint).
* You’ve got a Master’s degree in Supply Chain or another relevant field.

https://nl.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=f42af60320466f21,indeed,Technology Strategy & Advisory Manager - Products Industry,Accenture,https://nl.indeed.com/cmp/Accenture,"Amsterdam, NH, NL",fulltime,2024-07-22,,,,,False,,,dorine.hogendorp@accenture.com,"**The Work**

Are you a visionary leader ready to transformative and innovate businesses in the Products sector? Do you possess a deep understanding of the dynamic challenges our Consumer Goods & Services, Retail, Travel and Industrial clients are facing who have the ambition to digitalize their businesses, become more Agile, reduce IT cost, simplify their IT-landscape and move to the Cloud adopting value added services/technologies? If you're passionate about leveraging data insights and cutting-edge technology solutions to drive sustainable growth in the industry, particularly within the ‘Products’ sector, we want to hear from you!

We are Technology Strategy & Advisory! Our vision is to become the leading trusted advisors in harnessing technology and innovations as a force to reinvent every business. As part of our growing Technology Strategy & Advisory team, we are looking for a Technology Strategy & Advisory Manager specializing in the Products domain.

As a Manager you will work in high performance teams to address priority C-suite issues with precision and speed, tailored to the specific needs of Consumer Goods & Services, Retail, Travel and Industrial companies. Together with your team of young and enthusiastic colleagues, your role will be to help clients drive profitable growth through digital transformation, succeed in the generative AI era and generate enduring, long-term sustainable value. In addition to leading strategic initiatives and fostering innovation, you will help the client identify and capitalize on opportunities for business growth within the products sector. You help them gain an understanding of their most crucial challenges, analyze, and communicate your recommendations, to contribute to the client’s success, as well as Accenture’s.

* **Team** you will serve as a trusted advisor to our clients: In Technology Strategy & Advisory, we articulate a compelling technology vision with industry expertise and context. You will work with C-level executives, digital marketers and/or IT managers. With your ~80 colleagues you are at the heart of the change, developing value case and operating model with disruptive technologies in short to medium engagements. As a TS&A manager you will be positioned at the crucial intersection of business, technology and industry. We devise creative new strategies based on trends, insights and data. Our work always comes down to one thing: unlocking value and creating real, tangible impacts.

* **Processes** you get energy from solving complex puzzles and working in teams: Our consultants in Strategy & Consulting are changing businesses every day using industry insights, knowledge and innovative ideas. Applying data-driven methods to analyze our clients’ strategic challenges, solving complex problems and helping them realize their business strategy through the right use of new technologies. Beside the work for our clients you will also be contributing to our practice and help the team grow and develop by e.g. participating and organizing events, creating points-of-view, and sharing your knowledge.

* **Technology** convey a deep understanding of technology platforms and architecture: Convey deep understanding of technology platforms and architecture at intersection of client's industry to (re)define the client’s technology stack. Realize value, advise, and execute medium to longer term technology transformations such as multi-year Cloud journeys with a clear industry focus, leveraging cloud partners and platforms to drive innovation, flexibility and agility across enterprise and build new businesses.

* **Data** you will develop a data strategy, design innovations, and operating models: You will understand the importance of data for business decision making. Helping our clients to become truly data/insight driven by identifying a measurable business value from data & analytics, by designing and building the required capabilities and by driving embedding of data & analytics into their decisions, processes and day to day operations. You will learn teams how to do data-driven storytelling through quantitative analysis and data visualization.

With all our roles, there is some in-person time for collaboration, learning and building relationships with clients, peers, leaders, and communities. As an employer, we will be as flexible as possible to support your specific work/life needs.
**Who we are**

In today’s world, business leaders want to rapidly and confidently reinvent to increase resilience, mitigate risk, and grow with sustainable value. As a Senior Product Manager, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of GRESB. You will 'll work with an internationally talented team of UX designers, software engineers, data scientists and ESG experts to define the product roadmap, and build new data products for our clients.
The ideal candidate will have previous experience working in data companies (and preferably ESG) and experience with building data and visualization products.

You will be responsible for driving the development and execution of our real assets data products, collaborating closely with cross-functional teams to ensure the successful development of our product value proposition to the benefit of our customers.
The preferred location of this role will be at our headquarters in Amsterdam. However, we will also consider candidates located in Berlin, Paris or London.
**Key Responsibilities:**
* Understand the needs of financial market participants (investors, fund managers, asset operators) for ESG reporting and data collection through user research and market analysis
* Identify opportunities for new product and features, based on a clear product vision and roadmap aligned with business goals and user needs
* Prioritize features and translate them into actionable user stories
* Collaborate closely with our UX designer, engineering team, and data science teams
* Track key metrics and analyze data to measure the impact of product decisions
* Generally manage the product lifecycle from ideation to launch and post-launch evaluation
* Stay informed about industry trends and best practices related to ESG data, reporting, and product engineering
* Provide guidance and leadership to junior product team members and directly participate in the continuous improvement of our framework and processes
**Requirements**
* Master’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., business, engineering, environmental studies)
* 5+ years of experience as a Product Manager in the field of data analytics, (preferably in Fintech, Proptech, Real Estate or ESG/Climate sectors)
* Prior experience in SaaS companies (must)
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets (must)
* Familiarity with data visualization tools and techniques
* Product development skills and experience working with agile technical teams
* Excellent communication skills, verbal and writing. English is a must, any other language is a plus
* Ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects simultaneously
* Experience or direct exposure to ESG is a plus
**Benefits**
* Involvement in a fast growing international organisation that is globally recognised as the leading ESG benchmark for real assets
* Opportunity to work with a highly talented and committed team in a supportive environment with loads of camaraderie
* Annual leave of 25 days per calendar year
* Company pension plan
* Free public transport to and from the office
* Daily catered lunch at the office
* Annual professional development budget of EUR 2.500
* Frequent team events including an annual company retreat

GRESB is an equitable, diverse, and inclusive workplace, one at which all workers — regardless of their gender, race, ethnicity, national origin, age, sexual orientation, identity, education, or disability — feel valued and respected. We are committed to a non-discriminatory approach to hiring and provide equal opportunity for employment and advancement in all of our teams and programs. We respect and value diverse life experiences and heritages and work to ensure that all voices are valued and heard.
**About GRESB**

GRESB is a mission-driven and industry-led organization that provides actionable and transparent environmental, social and governance (ESG) data to financial markets. We collect, validate, score and benchmark ESG data to provide business intelligence, engagement tools and regulatory reporting solutions for investors, asset managers and the wider industry.
Our vision: An investment industry that plays a central role in creating a sustainable world
Our mission: To provide financial markets with actionable insights, ESG data and benchmarks.

Our ESG data and benchmarks now cover over USD 8.8 trillion in real estate and infrastructure value and are used by more than 150 institutional investors to make decisions that lead to a more sustainable world. We have an engaged community of asset managers who are proud to participate in our annual benchmarking process and a group of inspirational industry partners and ESG service providers who amplify our reach.

The GRESB team comes from diverse backgrounds with experience spanning sustainability, data science, software development, real estate, infrastructure, and the capital markets. We’re passionate about tackling the sustainability challenge by providing the insights that will power the markets of the future and enable investors to allocate the world’s capital in a more responsible way.

GRESB is an energetic group of over 100 people, covering dozens of different nationalities located in Amsterdam, with satellite offices in London, Paris, Berlin, Boston, Singapore and Sydney. https://nl.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=55dbe71c86fd1f83,indeed,Senior Business Analyst,MAERSK,https://nl.indeed.com/cmp/Maersk,"Den Haag, ZH, NL",fulltime,2024-07-22,,,,,False,,,accommodationrequests@maersk.com,"The Senior Business Analyst is part of the Strategy & Transformation Office (STO), reporting into the Transformation Lead for the Business Intelligence and Benchmarking program. As a Senior Business Analyst, you will be responsible for bridging the gap between business needs and data-driven solutions.
**Senior Business Analyst**
**Company**

A.P. Moller-Maersk (Maersk) is a worldwide transport and logistics company with offices in around 130 countries and with global headquarters in Copenhagen, Denmark. Maersk is listed on the Copenhagen Stock Exchange. Maersk employs roughly 95,000 people and generated total revenue of 51 billion USD in 2023. Maersk is currently undergoing a complex transformation from having been a relatively diversified conglomerate to becoming a focused transport and logistics company.

APM Terminals (APMT), a maritime terminal operator and core business unit of Maersk, operates one of the world’s most comprehensive port networks, which is uniquely positioned to help both shipping line- and landside customers grow their business and achieve better supply chain efficiency, flexibility and dependability to compete and win in world markets. The APMT team of 23,000 industry professionals across 42 countries and spanning five continents, is focused on providing customers with the most advanced terminal technology, equipment and operations in the industry across a network of +75 ports. In 2023, APM Terminals generated revenues 3.8 billion USD and carried out 40 million TEUs.

APMT is, like Maersk, undergoing an all-encompassing transformation from a multi-local, loosely coupled portfolio of individual terminals towards an integrated, best-in-class global terminal operator and stevedore. We casually refer to the journey as ‘ *from freestyle to franchise’* . The transformation involves developing and rolling out APMT’s *Way of Working* , built around a common operating system founded on Lean principles. It also entails a fundamental overhaul of our (digital) enterprise architecture to enable data-fueled business decisions, and cross-pollination of standard processes across our operations, including automation. Finally, the transformation aims to embed a culture of joint problem solving, (local) entrepreneurship and a collaborative mindset across our organization, including strong(er) linkages between our HQ- and frontline teams.
**Senior Business Analyst in the Business Intelligence & Benchmarking program**

The Senior Business Analyst is part of the Strategy & Transformation Office (STO), reporting into the Transformation Lead for the Business Intelligence and Benchmarking program. As a Senior Business Analyst, you will be responsible for bridging the gap between business needs and data-driven solutions. Your role is to be a partner to the business, in which you will collaborate with our leaders and (senior) business stakeholders to understand what drives value and assess indicators and data models for this. You will need to create an understanding of operational or business processes, develop models to represent this, and analyse data to create actionable insights. You will also work together closely with our data delivery teams to co-create what our data products need to look like, translated from business and technical requirements you help create. You will contribute to the broader roadmap of data-driven value identification across the business, and manage the project plans and initiatives to achieve this. Lastly you will lead more junior Business Analysts to ensure delivery of the required project plans against set time and scope.

This position requires a mix of strong analytical & logical thinking, business acumen, problem solving, data analysis skills and project management, as well as stakeholder management, soft skills and the ability to frame up, execute, and drive resolution to complex issues. This is a dynamic, fast paced role that involves simultaneously seeing the bigger picture along with the small pieces that are critical to success.
**We are looking for**
* A passion for working with senior business stakeholders in identifying value and improvement initiatives
* A strong analytical mind that can navigate complexity in operations and business, can distil priority areas, and can simplify this into a problem statement and (data-driven) solution plan
* Someone that utilizes data-savviness to think through use-cases and ensure that data solutions align with business and operational needs

* Someone with strong data analysis and modelling skills that can easily extract key insights and is able to spot key patterns in information. Proficiency in data analysis tools & techniques (Excel & SQL, data-querying or similar, advanced techniques are a plus)

* Someone that can present and visualize these insights in a logical and comprehensible way that helps drive actionable insights and supports business decisions. Proficiency in presentation, visualization and insights tools & techniques (Powerpoint & PowerBI or similar)
* Flexibility with the ability to manage multiple topics and projects simultaneously and take ownership and responsibility of projects, with the tenacity to see them through
* A collaborative team player that is hands-on with a can-do attitude and proactive
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills (both verbal and written). Possess empathy, personal tact, and multi-cultural understanding
* Strong project management skills, with experience in creating and managing project plans
* Familiarity with agile way-of-working and defining technical and business requirements

* A minimum of 6+ years work experience in a similar capacity, experience in generating or working with data-driven insights, and working with business and operational processes definition and analysis
* Consulting experience is a plus
* Experience with the logistics, transportation, or mining industry is a plus – experience in working with large complex (blue chip) companies is a must
* English fluency written and spoken, and international work experience is beneficial
* Based in the Netherlands, but willingness to travel
* Master’s degree in e.g., Math, Physics, Engineering, Econometrics, Finance, Business Administration, or similar

*Research shows that while male candidates feel confident enough to apply when they meet about 60% of the requirements, female candidates only apply when they tick every box. So if this role has your name on it, but you’re not sure about the criteria, we still want to hear from you.*

Maersk is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace, and we embrace different styles of thinking. Maersk is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applicants without regard to race, colour, gender, sex, age, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, marital status, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy or parental leave, veteran status, gender identity, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with all legal requirements.

We are happy to support your need for any adjustments during the application and hiring process. If you need special assistance or an accommodation to use our website, apply for a position, or to perform a job, please contact us by emailing accommodationrequests@maersk.com .",data visualization,https://maersk.wd3.myworkdayjobs.com/APMT_Careers/job/NLGWV03---The-Hague---De-Kroon/Senior-Business-Analyst_R113425,https://www.maersk.com/careers,"Copenhagen, Capital Region",,"10,000+",more than $10B (USD),,https://d2q79iu7y748jz.cloudfront.net/s/_squarelogo/256x256/da6eac5322453a95f0044e20d3412b9f,https://d2q79iu7y748jz.cloudfront.net/s/_headerimage/1960x400/1fd65632d2086d8cf7e30b8a081c1a86,Vincent Clerc,https://d2q79iu7y748jz.cloudfront.net/s/_ceophoto/512x512/a53484442e25bd2a393362e2bfdc517b,55dbe71c86fd1f83,,en,,,

Are you a visionary leader ready to transformative and innovate businesses in the energy sector? Do you possess a deep understanding of the dynamic challenges facing utilities, grid operators, and energy companies as they navigate the complexities of the energy transition and address issues like grid congestion? If you're passionate about leveraging data insights and cutting-edge technology solutions to drive sustainable growth the resources industry, particularly within the energy sector, we want to hear from you!

We are Technology Strategy & Advisory! Our vision is to become the leading trusted advisors in harnessing technology and innovations as a force to reinvent every business. As part of our growing Technology Strategy & Advisory team, we are looking for a Technology Strategy & Advisory Senior Manager specializing in the Resources domain.

As a manager you will work in high performance teams to address priority C-suite issues with precision and speed, tailored to the specific needs of utilities, grid operators, oils & gas, and chemical and energy companies. Together with your team of young and enthusiastic colleagues, your role will be to help clients transform successfully to accelerate the energy transition, optimize grid operations, and tackle challenges such as grid congestion. In addition to leading strategic initiatives and fostering innovation, you will leverage your sales acumen to identify and capitalize on opportunities for business growth within the energy sector. You help them gain an understanding of their most crucial challenges, analyze, and communicate your recommendations, to contribute to the client’s success, as well as Accenture’s.

* **Team** you will serve as a trusted advisor to our clients: In Technology Strategy & Advisory, we articulate a compelling technology vision with industry expertise and context. You will work with C-level executives, digital marketers and/or IT managers. With your ~80 colleagues you are at the heart of the change, developing value case and operating model with disruptive technologies in short to medium engagements. As a TS&A senior manager you will be positioned at the crucial intersection of business, technology and industry. We devise creative new strategies based on trends, insights and data. Our work always comes down to one thing: unlocking value and creating real, tangible impacts.

* **Processes** you get energy from solving complex puzzles and working in teams: Our consultants in Strategy & Consulting are changing businesses every day using industry insights, knowledge and innovative ideas. Applying data-driven methods to analyze our clients’ strategic challenges, solving complex problems and helping them realize their business strategy through the right use of new technologies. Beside the work for our clients you will also be contributing to our practice and help the team grow and develop by e.g. participating and organizing events, creating points-of-view, and sharing your knowledge.

* **Technology** convey a deep understanding of technology platforms and architecture: Convey deep understanding of technology platforms and architecture at intersection of client's industry to (re)define the client’s technology stack. Realize value, advise, and execute medium to longer term technology transformations such as multi-year Cloud journeys with a clear industry focus, leveraging cloud partners and platforms to drive innovation, flexibility and agility across enterprise and build new businesses.

* **Data** you will develop a data strategy, design innovations, and operating models: You will understand the importance of data for business decision making. Helping our clients to become truly data/insight driven by identifying a measurable business value from data & analytics, by designing and building the required capabilities and by driving embedding of data & analytics into their decisions, processes and day to day operations. You will learn teams how to do data-driven storytelling through quantitative analysis and data visualization.

With all our roles, there is some in-person time for collaboration, learning and building relationships with clients, peers, leaders, and communities. As an employer, we will be as flexible as possible to support your specific work/life needs.

https://nl.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=828781f4d529940f,indeed,Technology Strategy & Advisory Senior Manager,Accenture,https://nl.indeed.com/cmp/Accenture,"Amsterdam, NH, NL",fulltime,2024-07-22,,,,,False,,,dorine.hogendorp@accenture.com,"**The Work**

We are Technology Strategy & Advisory! Our vision is to become the leading trusted advisors in harnessing technology and innovations as a force to reinvent every business. As part of our growing Technology Strategy & Advisory team, we are looking for a Senior Technology Strategy & Advisory Manager. As a Senior Manager you will work in high performance teams to address priority C-suite issues with precision and speed. Together with your team of young and enthusiastic colleagues, your role will be to help clients transform successfully to stay ahead as information-driven, digital organizations. You help them gain an understanding of their most important challenges, analyze, and communicate your recommendations, to contribute to the client’s success, as well as Accenture’s.

* **Team** you will serve as a trusted advisor to our clients: In Technology Strategy & Advisory, we articulate a compelling technology vision with industry expertise and context. You will work with C-level executives, digital marketers and/or IT managers. With your ~80 colleagues you are at the heart of the change, developing value case and operating model with disruptive technologies in short to medium engagements. As a TS&A Senior Manager you will be positioned at the crucial intersection of business, technology and industry. We devise creative new strategies based on trends, insights and data. Our work always comes down to one thing: unlocking value and creating real, tangible impacts.

* **Processes** you get energy from solving complex puzzles and working in teams: Our consultants in Strategy & Consulting are changing businesses every day using industry insights, knowledge and innovative ideas. Applying data-driven methods to analyze our clients’ strategic challenges, solving complex problems and helping them realize their business strategy through the right use of new technologies. Beside the work for our clients you will also be contributing to our practice and help the team grow and develop by e.g. participating and organizing events, creating points-of-view, and sharing your knowledge.

* **Technology** convey a deep understanding of technology platforms and architecture: Convey deep understanding of technology platforms and architecture at intersection of client's industry to (re)define the client’s technology stack. Realize value, advise, and execute medium to longer term technology transformations such as multi-year Cloud journeys with a clear industry focus, leveraging cloud partners and platforms to drive innovation, flexibility and agility across enterprise and build new businesses.

* **Data** you will develop a data strategy, design innovations, and operating models: You will understand the importance of data for business decision making. Helping our clients to become truly data/insight driven by identifying a measurable business value from data & analytics, by designing and building the required capabilities and by driving embedding of data & analytics into their decisions, processes and day to day operations. You will learn teams how to do data-driven storytelling through quantitative analysis and data visualization.

With all our roles, there is some in-person time for collaboration, learning and building relationships with clients, peers, leaders, and communities. As an employer, we will be as flexible as possible to support your specific work/life needs.
**Who we are**

In today’s world, business leaders want to rapidly and confidently reinvent to increase resilience, mitigate risk, and grow with sustainable value. That’s where Accenture Strategy & Consulting comes in. We bring together strategic visionaries, industry experts, practitioners from across every enterprise function, business intelligence professionals, change specialists, data and AI authorities, and many other specialized skills to co-create each client’s unique path to reinvention. You will be a trusted partner to business leaders, working with a diverse team of experts to deliver successful tech-enabled transformation and new kinds of value for your clients. Join our global network of people using the latest assets, platforms and partnerships to help bring ideas to life.
Strategy & Consulting is one of five services that make up one Accenture – the others are Operations, Technology, Song and Industry X.
#LI-EU
**Here's what you'll need**

\* Do you want to work with great people and be part of a diverse team? We encourage you to apply even if you do not meet 100% of the below requirements. We are looking forward to meeting you, so don't hesitate to give us a call and discuss this! \*
* A finished Masters degree
* Multiple years of external consulting experience
* 8-12 years of experience in technology strategy and/or large scale digital and technology transformations
* Knowledge on latest technology advancements (in a certain technology area and/or industry) based on previous experience and interest in the latest innovations

* Consulting skills, e.g., solid financial and business acumen, structured and abstract thinking, analytical and creative problem solving, project management, prioritizing, communication, and stakeholder management
* Strong personality, presentation and communicative skills
* Fluent in English- spoken and written
* Proven affinity with Digital/IT and Technology (e.g., in your hobbies or work experience)
**Bonus Points If You Have**
* Fluency in Dutch
* Certifications e.g., Cloud, SAFe
**What's in it for you?**
* Accenture is a global company with a world-class brand and reputation. Our people are Change Makers, and to support them as an employer, we make five promises:
* Flexible working hours (4x9) & work location, and FlexDay

https://nl.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=ea2b9e3c4d9988b8,indeed,Full Stack Software Engineer (f/*/m),cradle,https://nl.indeed.com/cmp/Cradle,"Amsterdam, NH, NL",fulltime,2024-07-19,,,,,False,,,,"**Here's the tl
column2: dr:**

column1: * **We are on a mission** to make programming biology easy. We provide biologists with the software, machine learning & services to discover, design and optimise enzymes and their cell-factories to ultimately produce almost anything.
* We're an **experienced team**. We have built many successful products before and we have raised enough funds to have plenty of runway for the years to come!
* We're focused on building the **best possible team culture**. We're distributed across two locations, and are flexible about when and where we work.
* We offer **top of the market** salary, a generous equity stake in the company and a wide range of benefits from health and wellbeing, financial, to training and career progression opportunities.
**This is Cradle**

Cradle helps teams to engineer proteins with fewer, more successful experiments. We use generative machine learning models, accessible through user-friendly software interfaces, to help engineer protein properties such as stability, expression, activity, binding affinity and specificity. We are bridge builders who bring together the best of machine learning, synthetic biology, developer tools, and user experience design. Our mission is to enable a world where most of the products around us can be easily made and degraded biologically using a cell-factory instead of (petro-)chemicals, plants or animal agriculture.

In software we have an almost infinite degree of freedom on designing solutions. We at Cradle want to use this flexibility to provide a new level of experience for biological engineers. These engineers work on optimising proteins (sequences of amino acids), which currently includes a lot of expert knowledge and manual steps. We want to revolutionise their processes and build a ‘photoshop for proteins’ supported by machine learning. On that mission we deal with complex user objectives, diverse data structures and physical lab interactions while offering an easy to use, low code user interface.
**What we are looking for**

For this challenge we are looking for full stack software engineers who are excited to peek out of the virtual world and join us on designing a platform for optimizing biological systems. Be ready to witness first hand what happens when you leave the bits and bytes behind and try to solve challenges with nature’s constraints and complexity.
**Responsibilities**:
As a full stack software engineer, you would be responsible to:
* Develop a decoupled, service oriented platform application powered by sophisticated machine learning tools
* Implement lightweight and modularized web-based user interfaces and visualizations
* Support the team in establishing a stable, high quality and flexible software engineering process
* Collaborate with biologists, machine learning experts and scientists alike and learn to understand their domain
* Work in a cloud native runtime environment using Google Cloud, Kubernetes, helm, docker et al.
* Integrate a variety of existing tools for biological processes in the Cradle ecosystem
**Need to haves**
* Strong algorithmic and problem solving skills
* You enjoy designing software systems. We are in an early stage of the company where you will majorly contribute to the software design of the product.

* You are excited about all parts of the software stack which is reflected in your past projects. At any given day you could be asked to extend a web server API, contribute to a codon optimizer\*, or even implement a UI plugin.
* You are interested and excited about learning a new domain. You will be faced with a lot of new concepts and enjoy learning diverse topics.
* You have excellent knowledge of software development best practices, including code reviews, version control, and CI/CD pipelines.
* You are able to communicate well. We are working at the intersection of biology and software where good communication is key.
* You write readable code. Cradle aims to build a team of excellent computer scientists which includes advanced coding skills. We are set but not fixed on coding in Python at the moment.
* You are kind and work well both independently and in teams. We look for team players who contribute to a positive and friendly working environment.
* Do a little research online if you don’t know what this is :)
**Nice to haves**
* Extensive knowledge of the Python programming language and its ecosystem.
* A solid understanding of application development lifecycle, testing principles, and agile practices.
* You have worked with databases or big data systems.
* You have designed user interfaces and are familiar with one or more of the popular frameworks.
* You have been working on production systems for machine learning applications.
* Experience in building containerized backend systems using Docker and Kubernetes.
**Cradle helps biologists design improved proteins in record time using powerful prediction algorithms and AI design suggestions.**

We use generative machine learning models, accessible through user-friendly software interfaces, to help engineer protein properties such as stability, expression, activity, binding affinity and specificity. Our mission is to ultimately help more people build with biology and replacing traditional farms and factories for a more sustainable world.

You will be joining a high-growth, highly ambitious startup with an experienced founding team, whose motivation is building a more sustainable world using biology. We are backed by some of the most well known investors and industry veterans. Joining us now means you will be getting in on the ground floor
column2: you will have a significant impact on how we shape the company, and success will mean an outsized reward.

https://nl.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=bdaa19fff759ceee,indeed,Compliance AML Analytics Expert,Adyen,https://nl.indeed.com/cmp/Adyen,"Amsterdam, NH, NL",,2024-07-19,,,,,True,,,,"**This is Adyen**

Adyen provides payments, data, and financial products in a single solution for customers like Meta, Uber, H&M, and Microsoft - making us the financial technology platform of choice. At Adyen, everything we do is engineered for ambition.

For our teams, we create an environment with opportunities for our people to succeed, backed by the culture and support to ensure they are enabled to truly own their careers. We are motivated individuals who tackle unique technical challenges at scale and solve them as a team. Together, we deliver innovative and ethical solutions that help businesses achieve their ambitions faster.
**Compliance AML Analytics Expert**

Our Compliance AML Analytics team (part of the wider Second Line AML Compliance team) is looking for an experienced AML Data Expert. The successful candidate must have strong analytical skills combined with deep knowledge on Anti-Money Laundering ('AML'). This will enable the candidate to advise and challenge the First Line teams on both the regulatory and the technical aspects of Adyen's transaction monitoring framework.

The AML Data Analytics team is overseeing Adyen's transaction monitoring framework from a global perspective. Given the dynamic environment of our company and the wider industry, this framework is continuously changing and enhanced. The team works closely with the teams responsible for developing and maintaining the transaction monitoring processes, the AML investigative teams, and internal and external authorities such as model validation, internal audit, and supervisors and regulators.
**What you'll do**
* Inform, advise, and independently challenge the business on matters relating to transaction monitoring and the application of analytics to AML efforts
* Draft and review procedures, guidelines, and technical model documentation
* Support new product launches through risk assessments and design of new transaction monitoring methods
* Create validation tools/processes and perform thematic data analysis to drive improvements to the transaction monitoring framework
* Liaise with internal and external stakeholders, such as model validation, internal audit, and relevant regulators and supervisors
* Represent the wider AML Compliance team on a variety of work-streams to establish strategies that align with global objectives and ensure controlled and compliant growth
column2: and,

column1: * Strengthen knowledge management on AML, data, and analytics across the global business.
**Who you are**
* You have at least 4 years' experience in the payments or banking industry

* You have a proven track record in developing or advising on transaction monitoring frameworks, AML analytics, or equivalent experience (working with development/analytical teams in a compliance setting)
* You have excellent organizational skills and know how to manage a project from conception to launch
* You are comfortable writing queries in SQL and/or Python/Pyspark and have experience using visualization tools like Looker
* You are a quick learner and take a 'launch fast and iterate' approach to tackling problems
column2: and,

column1: * You have strong communication skills and can work well with both technical and commercial teams.
**Our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion commitments**

Our unique approach is a product of our diverse perspectives. This diversity of backgrounds and cultures is essential in helping us maintain our momentum. Our business and technical challenges are unique, and we need as many different voices as possible to join us in solving them - voices like yours. No matter who you are or where you're from, we welcome you to be your true self at Adyen.

Studies show that women and members of underrepresented communities apply for jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications. Does this sound like you? If so, Adyen encourages you to reconsider and apply. We look forward to your application!
**What's next?**

Ensuring a smooth and enjoyable candidate experience is critical for us. We aim to get back to you regarding your application within 5 business days. Our interview process tends to take about 4 weeks to complete, but may fluctuate depending on the role. Learn more about our hiring process here. Don't be afraid to let us know if you need more flexibility.
This role is based out of our Amsterdam office. We are an office-first company and value in-person collaboration

column1: https://nl.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=391c628fafe12925,indeed,Outsystems Developer,TIP GROUP,https://nl.indeed.com/cmp/Tip-Group-5,"Amsterdam, NH, NL",fulltime,2024-07-19,,,,,True,,,,"**TIP/Apollo –** **Senior** **Outsystems** **Developer**
Location: ASC – Amsterdam (to start with)
Job type: Experienced (5+ years , ideally 7+ years )
Function: Senior Outsystem Developer for Connected Applications
Reporting to: CDO and Head of Product
**Company Overview**

TIP Group is a leading equipment service provider. With years of experience, we are experts in providing all services that a customer will require during the life cycle of a trailer, tanker, or other type of equipment, making us a one-stop shop for all our customers’ equipment needs.
Headquartered in Amsterdam, we service our customers from 128 locations spread over 18 countries in Europe.
**Job Summary**

The transportation, logistics , and the trailer industry is undergoing a transformation that will last for several years. This is a unique opportunity to become a part of a new TIP Group venture whereby you’ll be shaping solutions to address the s eis mic changes in the industry
column2: with the shared goal of electrification and digitization of logistics fleets and workshops across Europe/at-scale as a senior developer. You’ll be a part of an enterprising and newly built team with an opportunity to set and define a new culture and ways of working with team members with both, corporate and startup backgrounds. The code you write, features you develop, and existing functionality you maintain – all will have a massive impact on how transportation fleets are managed in Europe . In addition, you’ll be writing code to facilitate business and workshop processes.

column1: As senior developer for this new TIP Group venture , you are aplty skilled in using Outsystems to deliver scalable business outcomes (payments, IAM solutions, data visualization, etc. and more). Furthermore, you have some experience in writing and maintaining performant as well as scable applications. You care deeply about code quality and getting from 0 to 1 in an efficient way, both at the same time. Comfortable with taking initiative in an agile context and in dealing with stakeholders.
**Essential Functions / Responsibilities**
* Lead a team of engineering resources.
* Work with Technology and business product owners on shaping project requirements and solutions and responsible for solution delivery.
* Collaborate with a team of IT professionals to set specifications for new applications and third-party dependencies
* R&D and development on the user stories.
* Regular interaction with offshore/onshore.
* Enhancements and Bug fixing.
* Evaluate existing applications for updates and add new features.
* Develop technical documents and handbooks to accurately represent application design and code ( boyscouting ) .
* Integrate software components and third-party programs and libraries.
* Troubleshoot, debug , and iterate over existing software.
* Setting standard for database migrations and disaster recovery protocols
* You bring microservice experience at the enterprise level and understand all the moving parts

Whilst the above outlines the main duties of the post the list is not exhaustive, and duties may need to change in the light of future developments or from time to time as directed by your supervisor or manager.
**Qualifications/Requirements**
* At least 5-7 years of hands-on professional experience Outsystems development experience in designing and developing enterprise applications (Mandatory), ideally some of it as a tech lead.
* Bachelor’s or Masters in Computer Science or related discipline (Mandatory).
* Fluent in Dutch , German, and English : both written and spoken (Mandatory). Any other European language, especially German, is a distinct advantage.
* Proficiency in web and mobile application development using OutSystems (Mandatory).
* Deep understanding of No Code/Low Code theories and concepts, like Workflow Automation, Component Reusability, Rapid Prototyping, and integration using REST/SOAP/other APIs (Mandatory).
* Knowledge of and experience with Frontend technologies React, Angular, Vue, etc. (Mandatory)
* Familiar with microservices architecture and experienced in AWS cloud services and Postgres databases
* Knowledge of object-oriented design and design patterns, and programming skills.
* Experience in designing and implementing APIs and Microservices.
* Strong concepts of clean code principles.
* Experience with relational/non-relational databases. You understand how they work and how to unlock stakeholder and business value using them.
* Able to understand and apply design patterns.
* Experience with container technologies (Docker or similar) is also desirable.
* Experience in working with external or remote teammates
* Interested in growing as a software engineer participating actively in the whole development cycle (frontend, backend, database, testing, DevOps...)
* Must be driven and flexible enough to succeed in somewhat ambiguous situations.
* Fast learner, analytical and problem solver, keen to adopt the latest technologies in a challenging environment.

We believe diversity drives innovation. The variety of nationalities, cultures, religions and ethnic backgrounds enrich our workforce by bringing together new ideas, innovations and thinking styles that lead to business success. Integrity, honesty and ethical behavior are at the core of our business. When we have a vacancy, we welcome everyone who has the potential, skills, commitment and honest way of working into our TIP family.",data visualization,https://tiptrailerservices.wd3.myworkdayjobs.com/en-US/TIPTrailerServices_Careers/job/Amsterdam/Outsystems-Developer_R0013749,https://www.tip-group.com,Amsterdam,,"1,001 to 5,000",$1B to $5B (USD),"TIP Group is one of Europe and Canada's leading equipment services providers. Dynatrace provides software intelligence to simplify cloud complexity and accelerate digital transformation. With automatic and intelligent observability at scale, our all-in-one platform delivers precise answers about the performance and security of applications, the underlying infrastructure, and the experience of all users to enable organizations to innovate faster, collaborate more efficiently, and deliver more value with dramatically less effort. That’s why many of the world’s largest organizations trust Dynatrace®️ to modernize and automate cloud operations, release better software faster, and deliver unrivaled digital experiences.
**Job Description**

The ACE Services Architect designs, delivers, and evolves our strategic services offerings. An Architect represents Dynatrace as expert in the practice of application performance management, providing customers with the means to extend the Dynatrace platform along their digital transformation journeys.

A natural problem solver who likes a variety of challenges while working in complex environments. With regular interactions across many stakeholders both internally as well as with customers and partners, a strong business acumen is required as well as a strong technical background. Combined with the ability to communicate clearly, credibly, and confidently, Architects will be the direct cause of outstanding experiences at our customers. You will be part of a global team of experts and architects, and you will be responsible for mentoring Dynatrace Services teammates on best practice delivery techniques.
**Responsibilities:**

* Serve as subject matter expert on techniques and best practices for driving value from Dynatrace, particularly through ecosystem integrations, combining product expertise with your skills and experience
* Consult with customers to understand, and then meet their business and technical goals
* Develop, deliver, and support services engagements focused on integrating Dynatrace into key systems such as ServiceNow and Splunk
* Participate in project scoping and integration architectural deployment design
* Partner with the sales team as needed in presales technical sessions
* Recommend complementary Dynatrace products features to meet customer goals
* Through project and thought leadership, actively work to improve our practices and procedures
**Qualifications** **Required Skills:**
* 5+ years of consulting experience or equivalent industry experience
* 3 years of demonstrated high customer satisfaction
* Deep understanding of Dynatrace Architecture and configurations of SaaS, Managed and offline
* 4 industry certifications in differing technologies (e.g. AWS, Google Cloud, Kubernetes, PMP)
* Solid understanding of the application life cycle, and how Dynatrace adds value at each stage
* Strong architectural understanding of application platforms and a self-directed willingness to learn about “new stack” enterprise cloud technologies

* Able to formulate program strategies by evaluating options with a clear sense of priorities and risks. Manage information from multiple parallel work streams and integrate them to form an overall view
* Demonstrated field experience with ServiceNow and Splunk systems, inclusive of effective integration approaches into these platforms
* Demonstrated experience with data visualization via charts and dashboards, including appropriate use of granular and aggregate data
* Ability to simplify complex technical issues and tailor for the relevant stakeholder groups
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills and attention to detail
* Outstanding at presenting solutions to audiences ranging from the developers to C-level executives
* A minimum of Dynatrace Professional Certification working towards Master certification
**Desired Experience:**
* Previous consulting experience and / or Project Management experience is a plus
* Cloud and Infrastructure technologies such as AWS, Azure, OpenStack, Cloud Foundry, Kubernetes etc.
* Ability to write or contribute to technical white papers and blogs
* 1 security and 1 automation certification
**Additional Information** **Travel and Training Requirements**
* Most Dynatrace Services client engagements completed by Architects are short to mid-term assignments but usually do not require travel. However, on occasion, site visits may be required
* Must be willing to attend training at a Dynatrace or other location as well as potential travel for in-the-field observation activities

https://nl.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=33fa20f39588c7ed,indeed,Project Management Office,,,"Zaltbommel, GE, NL",,2024-07-05,,,,,False,,,,"**About ITsPeople**

ITsPeople is a top-tier management and consulting firm, specializing in digital transformation and strategic management. We empower our clients to overcome complex business challenges and achieve their strategic goals through innovative solutions and large-scale transformation projects. As digitalization reshapes the business landscape, we are dedicated to helping our clients navigate these changes and enhance their operational efficiency and market position.
**Role Overview**

The ITs Productivity Center (IPC) ensures the smooth execution of ITsPeople projects. The IPC is a PMO team that provides structure, quality, visualization, and efficiency. The team comprises young, eager employees with diverse backgrounds. Within the IPC, young professionals have the opportunity to explore and gain experience in various projects related to project management, consultancy, and data.

The IPC is involved in all projects and assignments of ITsPeople, offering support to colleagues. PMOs ensure that progress and actions in assignments are visible, partly through the use of dashboards.

Within the IPC, you are involved in all organizational activities, gaining comprehensive exposure. ITsPeople is a flat organization where, as a PMO employee, one day you might shadow a project manager, and the next, contribute to a proposal for a major (new) client. New employees join a team of colleagues where they can develop themselves. At ITsPeople, you will have the opportunity, with guidance, to develop and discover your strengths and interests.
**Key Responsibilities**
* Support project managers and consultants
* Monitor and improve quality in projects
* Ensure proper structure and progress of projects
* Assist in implementing best practices
* Ensure efficient project execution
* Visualize data via dashboards
* Contribute to writing proposals
**Qualifications**
* MBO/HBO level of education in a relevant field
* Strong command of the Dutch language. Knowledge of English is a plus
* Proficient in Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook
* Preferably familiar with supporting programs and projects
* Able to navigate digital systems effectively, optimizing the setup of colleagues' tasks
* A true team player with strong collaboration skills
* Attentive to functional relationships, interests, and sensitivities, and able to quickly switch between various topics
**Personal Attributes**
* **Analytical Thinking**: Strong analytical skills with attention to detail and a comprehensive understanding of business processes and their interconnections.
* **Result-Oriented**: Focused on achieving measurable results and continuously improving processes to meet and exceed business objectives.
* **Flexible and Adaptable**: Capable of quickly adapting to new challenges and changing circumstances.
* **Team Player**: Able to collaborate within diverse teams, promoting a cooperative and productive work environment.
* **Personal Leadership**: Shows self-motivation, initiative, and the ability to lead and inspire others without formal authority.
* **Networking Skills**: Possesses a professional network and the ability to build new relationships that support business and client engagement.
**Why Join ITsPeople?**

At ITsPeople, you will be part of a dynamic and forward-thinking team dedicated to driving transformative change for our clients. We value independence, innovation, and a collaborative spirit. Joining our team means you will have the opportunity to work on high-impact projects at the forefront of digital transformation and AI integration, helping organizations navigate and thrive in an increasingly complex business environment.

We offer a supportive and flexible work environment that encourages personal and professional growth. You will have the autonomy to manage your projects, engage with senior executives, and make a significant impact on the businesses we serve.",data visualization,https://www.joinitspeople.nl/jobs/4712092-project-management-office,,,,,,,,,,,33fa20f39588c7ed,,en,,,
https://nl.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=b0bde70e9c6d4cbc,indeed,Data Scientist,,,"Zaltbommel, GE, NL",,2024-07-04,,,,,False,,,,"**About ITsPeople**

ITsPeople is a leading management and consulting firm specializing in guiding organizations through complex digital transformations and enhancing their organizational agility. We empower our clients to navigate and overcome intricate business challenges by leveraging data-driven insights and managing large-scale transformation projects. Our mission is to help companies strengthen their market position by adopting advanced data analytics and AI, fostering a culture of agility, and driving sustained operational excellence.
**Role Overview**

As a Data Scientist at ITsPeople, you will be instrumental in transforming data into actionable insights that support our clients' strategic objectives. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to solve complex problems, develop predictive models, and drive data-driven decision-making. This role is ideal for a highly analytical individual with a passion for uncovering patterns and insights from large datasets and communicating these findings effectively.
**Key Responsibilities**
* **Data Collection and Preparation:** Gather, clean, and prepare large datasets from various sources for analysis, ensuring data quality and integrity.
* **Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA):** Conduct exploratory analyses to discover trends, patterns, and anomalies in data, providing valuable insights to stakeholders.
* **Predictive and Diagnostic Modeling:** Develop, implement, and evaluate machine learning models and algorithms to predict outcomes and diagnose issues.
* **Machine Learning and AI:** Apply advanced statistical and machine learning techniques to build models that address business challenges and optimize processes.
* **Data Visualization and Reporting:** Create compelling visualizations and dashboards to communicate data insights and support decision-making processes.
* **Collaboration and Teamwork:** Work closely with project teams, including data engineers, business analysts, and domain experts, to understand requirements and deliver data-driven solutions.
* **Continuous Learning and Improvement:** Stay updated with the latest trends and advancements in data science and technology to continually improve methodologies and tools.
**Required Qualifications**
* **Education:** Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
* **Experience:** 0 to 3 years of experience in data science, analytics, or a related role. We welcome enthusiastic individuals looking to start or advance their career in data science.

* **Technical Skills:** Proficiency in Python, SQL, and data visualization tools such as Jupyter Notebook, Tableau, or similar platforms. Experience with machine learning frameworks (e.g., Scikit-Learn, TensorFlow) is a plus.
* **Soft Skills:** Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders and collaborate effectively within teams.
* **Language skills:** Fluency in Dutch and English is required.
**Personal Attributes**
* **Analytical Mindset:** Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to derive meaningful insights from complex data sets.
* **Detail Oriented:** Attention to detail in data analysis, modeling, and reporting, ensuring accuracy and reliability in all deliverables.
* **Proactive and Driven:** Self-motivated and proactive in seeking out new challenges and opportunities to apply data science.
* **Team Player:** Collaborative spirit with the ability to work effectively in multidisciplinary teams and contribute to a positive team dynamic.
* **Personal Leadership:** Demonstrates initiative, responsibility, and the ability to lead and inspire others without formal authority.
**Training and Development**

At ITsPeople, we believe in the growth and development of our team members. We offer a robust training program designed to equip new and emerging professionals with the skills and knowledge needed to excel in their roles. Our comprehensive training covers the latest in data science techniques, tools, and industry best practices, providing you with the foundation to succeed and grow within our dynamic team.
**Why Join ITsPeople?**

Joining ITsPeople means being part of a vibrant and supportive team dedicated to driving transformative change for our clients through data-driven solutions. We value innovation, collaboration, and a customer-centric approach. As a Data Scientist, you will have the opportunity to work on high-impact projects, engage with a diverse range of clients, and contribute significantly to their success.

We offer a stimulating work environment that promotes professional development and personal growth. You will have the autonomy to manage your projects, collaborate with senior consultants, and play a key role in our data-driven strategies.",data visualization,https://www.joinitspeople.nl/jobs/4705973-data-scientist,,,,,,,,,,,b0bde70e9c6d4cbc,,en,,,
https://nl.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=76fc785cd06bbbe7,indeed,Business Analyst,,,"Zaltbommel, GE, NL",,2024-07-03,,,,,False,,,,"**About ITsPeople**

This role is ideal for a detail-oriented professional with strong analytical skills and a passion for bridging the gap between business and technology.

* **Requirement Gathering and Analysis:** Collaborate with stakeholders to elicit and document business requirements, ensuring a clear understanding of their needs and objectives.

* **Solution Design and Implementation**: Develop and propose solutions that meet business requirements and align with strategic goals, working closely with IT teams to implement and test these solutions.
* **Data Analysis and Reporting:** Perform data analysis to uncover trends, patterns, and insights that inform decision-making and strategy development.
* **Stakeholder Communication:** Serve as a liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams, ensuring clear and effective communication of requirements and project updates.
* **Documentation and Training:** Prepare detailed documentation, including business cases, process flows, and user guides. Provide training and support to end-users on new systems and processes.

* **Project Support**: Assist in project planning and execution, including defining project scope, timelines, and deliverables, and monitoring project progress to ensure timely and successful completion.
**Required Qualifications**
* **Education:** Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Business Administration, Information Technology, or a related field.

* **Soft Skills:** Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills, with the ability to translate complex business needs into clear technical requirements.
* Language Proficiency: Fluency in Dutch and English is essential.
**Personal Attributes**
* **Analytical Thinker:** Ability to analyze complex business problems and develop innovative solutions that align with strategic goals.
* **Detail-Oriented:** Strong attention to detail, ensuring accuracy and thoroughness in analysis and documentation.
* **Effective Communicator:** Excellent communication skills, capable of articulating technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders and vice versa.
* **Proactive and Adaptable:** Self-motivated with a proactive approach to problem-solving, able to adapt to changing priorities and demands.
* **Team Player**: Collaborative spirit, with the ability to work effectively within cross-functional teams and build strong relationships with stakeholders.
**Preferred Skills**
* **Experience with Agile Methodologies:** Understanding and experience with Agile methodologies and their application in business analysis and project management.
* **Knowledge of Digital Transformation:** Familiarity with the concepts and practices of digital transformation and its impact on business processes and strategies.
* **Certification in Business Analysis:** Professional certifications such as Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) or PMI-PBA are highly desirable.
**Why Join ITsPeople?**

At ITsPeople, you will be part of a dynamic and forward-thinking team dedicated to driving transformative change for our clients. We value analytical insight, innovation, and a collaborative spirit. https://nl.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=611e1f79f190eddf,indeed,"Insights Program Analyst, Ring",Amazon.com,https://nl.indeed.com/cmp/Amazon.com,"Amsterdam, NH, NL",fulltime,2024-05-03,,,,,False,,,,"* Bachelor's degree or equivalent
* Experience defining requirements and using data and metrics to draw business insights
* Experience in Excel (including VBA, pivot tables, array functions, power pivots, etc.) and data visualization tools such as Tableau
* Experience making business recommendations and influencing stakeholders
* Experience with SQL
* Experience with technical troubleshooting, triaging, aggregating trends, and reporting.

Join a collaborative team of product experts dedicated to developing innovative home security solutions that improve the lives of millions. In this role, you'll work cross-functionally with stakeholders in product, engineering, program management, logistics, business intelligence, and go-to-market to support the successful launch of new Ring consumer products, features, and services.

As an Insights Program Analyst, you will be the critical link between our products and customers. You'll engage directly with participants in Alpha, Beta, and Delta testing programs, reviewing and analyzing their feedback to identify key trends and issues. Your quantitative analysis and detailed reports will inform product improvements and drive engineering priorities. You'll also proactively communicate with testers to encourage participation, survey responses, and feature usage throughout each testing cycle.

https://nl.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=77a8af0f8e2461de,indeed,Data Science Lead,,,"Amsterdam, NH, NL",fulltime,2023-12-20,,,,,False,,,,"At Adaptfy, we are looking for a Data Science Lead to join our Team in Amsterdam.
